results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we are excited to have Taku Harada (Peatix) come by and share his journey.

Taku founded Peatix together with his former colleagues at Amazon, and has served as its CEO since its inception. Taku also held the position of Representative Director and CEO of Yoox Japan until August 2009. Prior to Yoox, he held various positions at Amazon Japan including head of its mobile and online marketing divisions. He also launched the iTunes Music Store in Japan while at Apple in 2005 and led its marketing team. He began his career at Sony Music Entertainment's international business affairs division in Japan. He holds a B.A. from Yale University.

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.

Until then, stay cool and classy... See you then!

Future events:

results.description:
DER WEG ZUM GLÜCKLICHEN UND VERANTWORTUNGSVOLLEN MENSCHEN

Es ist das Ziel aller Eltern, ihr Kind darin zu unterstützen, ein glücklicher und verantwortungsvoller Mensch zu werden, der die Herausforderungen des Lebens erfolgreich meistert und erfüllende Beziehungen hat. Die Grundsteine für eine solch positive Entwicklung werden schon ab den ersten Wochen gelegt. Es ist ein anspruchsvolles – und doch mögliches – Ziel!

Wir zeigen Erziehungspraktiken, die auf den Prinzipien der Bindungstheorie aufbauen. Diese Praktiken erfüllen auf der einen Seite das natürliche Bedürfnis des Kindes nach Vertrauen und Bindung, und auf der anderen Seite den Drang, seine Umgebung und die Welt zu erkunden. Die Bildung stabiler und gesunder Beziehungen zwischen Ihnen und Ihrem Kind/Ihren Kindern ist die Voraussetzung dafür, dass die Kinder als Erwachsene solide und zufriedenstellende Beziehungen aufbauen und erhalten können, und zwar sowohl im privaten als auch im beruflichen Leben.

Wir werden die folgenden Fragen diskutieren und sie auf Ihren Alltag und Ihre Erfahrung als Eltern beziehen:

1.) Was bedeutet Bindung und wieso ist sie so wichtig?
2.) Wie Sie Ihrem Kind eine sichere Basis geben können, von der es seine nähere und weitere Umgebung erkunden kann.
3.) Wie Sie die Balance halten können zwischen emotionaler Bindung und Struktur und Grenzen setzen.
4.) Wie Sie verstehen können, was Ihnen Ihr Kind sagen will.
5.) Wie Sie Ihrem Kind ein gutes Vorbild zum Aufbau und Erhalt von stabilen Beziehungen sein können.
6.) Unterschiedliche Bindungsstile: Wie sehen diese aus und was bedeuten sie für die Entwicklung Ihres Kindes und dessen Anpassungs- und Durchsetzungsfähigkeit im Leben.
7.) Was, wenn Sie einen Fehler machen? – Es gibt keine perfekten Eltern, oder generell perfekte Menschen. Es ist die Art, wie wir Brüche in unseren Beziehungen reparieren, die den Unterschied ausmacht. Wie also können wir die momentanen Brüche reparieren?

Wir werden diese Fragen und Themen auf verschiedene Altersgruppen beziehen und darauf ausrichten, wie Sie Ihr Kind am besten dahingehend unterstützen koennen, die bestmögliche emotional und soziale Entwicklung zu durchlaufen.

Tuition:
$39 per Person

Register here:

THIS SEMINAR IS HELD IN GERMAN

(This seminar is periodically held in English with the title: Successful Parenting - Raising Happy & Resilient Kids)

Speaker Bio:

Dr. Kraemer is a clinical psychologist, licensed in the State of New York.  She has a psychotherapy practice, with an emphasis on aspects of the parent-child-relationship (Parenting At Its Best), issues around aging (Aging At Its Best), as well as the relationship between eating behavior and one’s own body. Dr. Kraemer also serves as part time faculty at The New School for Public Engagement.  Additionally, she is an internationally sought after instructor at various professional development schools and institutes.
results.name: Resilient Kids - Grundsteine erfolgreicher Erziehung

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.

results.description:
SIGN UP HERE

With the sudden boom in small, powerful, affordable cameras hitting the modern market, Street Photography has begun a new renaissance, with the form being more accessible than ever to photographers who find their stories by pounding the pavement, camera in hand, hunting for light and the ever allusive “Decisive Moment” 


This afternoon workshop will offer an introduction to those who are interested in making street based work, and an invigorating set of tips and tricks for those who have already worn through a good pair of walking shoes seeking meaningful images. With a quick lecture and discussion on established street photo practices to begin, and then a group shooting session starting at Adorama and working our way down town wherever the light leads us, this session offers a new base of knowledge for those seeking it, as well as a great opportunity to meet fellow street shooters in NYC.

Biography

Daniel Schaefer is a photographer and writer based wherever his lens and pen are most useful. Currently making work in NYC he is known for his cinematically charged images ranging from delicately lit portraiture, to visceral shots of the lively NYC streets. His writings on photo theory have been met by much community acclaim, with industry standard sites like Petapixel, the Phoblographer, Japan Camera Hunter and Fstoppers publishing his articles. His work can be found at OutlierImagery.com or @OutlierImagery
results.name: Street Technique - Finding your flow: Workshop & photo walk

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.

results.description:
Please join us as graduating students, the Closers demo their Byte Academy capstone project - BOTSERVER, followed by a celebration.  Mingle with students, entrepreneurs, the Byte Academy team, founders and business leaders to kick off your FinTech Friday.

TONIGHT's DEMO:  Conversational Commerce is the opportunity to inject a commercial transaction in a messaging conversation. Quite timely, as messaging data flow has outstripped social media posts, and people realize they use only five or so apps on their smart phones (the most used being messaging).  Conversation BOTS - smart agents that listen on relevant IM conversations - allow businesses to interact programmatically with their community and learn, over time, what is important. Slackbot, and Facebook M are two early examples of conversational bots that also use Artificial Intelligence to respond, learn and accumulate information from a community. Bots are also a personnel multiplier, as they can respond to repetitive but necessary interactions, like product inquries (FAQs), company culture onboarding, The Closers cohort will present BOTSERVER, a technology for choosing and implementing different types of bots into a Slack environment.  Additionally, we will also demonstrate a few bots of our creation, including Super_Kei (a FAQ-responding bot) and AZIZ_bot (an AI-powered conversation tone analyzer, that uses the IBM Watson AI API to determine stress, anger, happines and fear in an IM conversation and respond accordingly).

About Byte Academy : Byte Academy offers intensive full and part-time courses that emphasize full-stack programming using Python and industry-oriented programs such as FinTech (financial technology), Data Sciences and MedTech.  Byte Academy is the first coding bootcamp in the world to offer a Financial Technology (FinTech) program and the first in New York City to teach full stack Python. Small classes, career services and placement including access to top industry professionals and events are included in the program.  Byte Academy offers comprehensive financial aid and all women receive $2,000 scholarships. Byte Academy accepts applications on a rolling basis for all courses which start every 4 weeks.

Byte Academy was just nominated for the Benzinga FinTech Awards, please vote here to show support http://bit.ly/1Ljq2DJ
results.name: Artificial Intelligence: Demo Day & Graduation

group.name: Byte Academy: FinTech, Data Science, Python Coding Bootcamp

Fabulous winter fun - take your pick of skiing, ice climbing, snowshoeing, winter hiking, and skating!

Activities:


• Downhill skiing at Whiteface

• Cross country skiing: 70km of groomed trails at Cascade Ski Center and Van Hoevenberg for all levels, Whiteface Toll Road and Jack Rabbit Trail for int/adv. Gear rental at Cascade and VH centers. 

• Snowshoeing: many great hikes and peaks for all levels

• Ice Climbing (guided options) 

• Ice Skating in Lake Placid 


• Technical Mountaineering requiring ice axes and crampons (guided options) 

All hikes/activities are member organized, not guided or led by anyone. (Unless you actually hire a guide.) 

It is your responsibility to have researched the routes and have the experience, physical ability, and correct equipment to safely complete them. Attendance of this meetup means you acknowledge and accept this responsibility.

Transportations: Please comment below if you need a ride or if you can offer a ride.

Gear:
Standard winter hiking gear suitable for single digit temperatures

That includes:
- Wicking base-layer, insulating mid-layer, and waterproof shell, big puffy jacket 
- Winter hat, gloves, socks
- Chemical hand and foot warmers
- ADK Map: The National Geographic High Peaks Map is pretty good

Snowshoes are required for all hikes.

Weather:
Expect temperatures in the teens, but come prepared for single digits and high winds on the summits. You might get to earn your 0°F!

Forecast for the peaks

Groomed Cross Country

The Whiteface Toll Road and other backcountry-cross country ski routes. 

Snowshoeing

Ice Climbing
results.name: Multi-sport Winter Fun in the Adirondacks

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at pret a manger to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if the class is more than 3 people and $15/person if the class is 1 to 3 people.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.

****PLEASE READ:  YOU MUST PREPAY FOR THIS EVENT USING THE LINK IN THE EVENTS DESCRIPTION.  THIS EVENT IS BEING SPONSORED BY THE NEW YORK SOCIAL NETWORK AND SEVERAL OF THEIR PARTNER MEET UP GROUPS.   

Love art, hate art or just don't understand art? It doesn't matter because this event is more about socializing, making new friends and having fun! You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions and take picture challenges. The group will meet at The Old Castle Tavern for cocktails between 6PM and 6:30 PM. Upon check-in we will group people together into teams Bring your camera!

WHAT AM I LOOKING FOR AT THE MUSEUM:
All The Clues are things that are already at the museum. It is in the paintings, sculptures, gift shops, hallways, signs and the people who are there. Each team will have 75 minutes to find as many clues as possible. The teams with the most points will win prizes. Each team will have one hour to complete. Don't worry if you don't answer all the items because they are bonus points. We will be joining another large meet up group for this event. Following the tour we will gather back at the Old Castle Tavern for food and drinks!

COST- $15.00 GENERAL ADMISSION

-Admission to MOMA

results.description:
Graduation Demo Day - "FinTech Friday Demo & Graduation"

Please join us as graduating students, the Closers demo their Byte Academy capstone project - BOTSERVER, followed by a celebration.  Mingle with students, entrepreneurs, the Byte Academy team, founders and business leaders to kick off your FinTech Friday.

TONIGHT's DEMO:  Watch our BOTS! Conversational Commerce is the opportunity to inject a commercial transaction in a messaging conversation. Quite timely, as messaging data flow has outstripped social media posts, and people realize they use only five or so apps on their smart phones (the most used being messaging).  

Conversation BOTS - smart agents that listen on relevant IM conversations - allow businesses to interact programmatically with their community and learn, over time, what is important. Slackbot, and Facebook M are two early examples of conversational bots that also use Artificial Intelligence to respond, learn and accumulate information from a community. 

Bots are also a personnel multiplier, as they can respond to repetitive but necessary interactions, like product inquries (FAQs), company culture onboarding, and daily standup meetings/

The Closers cohort will present BOTSERVER, a technology for choosing and implementing different types of bots into a Slack environment.  

Additionally, we will also demonstrate a few bots of our creation, including Super_Kei (a FAQ-responding bot) and AZIZ_bot (an AI-powered conversation tone analyzer, that uses the IBM Watson AI API to determine stress, anger, happines and fear in an IM conversation and respond accordingly).  

The Closers won the top prize in the recent (Feb 19, 2016) Stamford (CT) Hackathon 2.0.  They chose the Artificial Intelligence track using the IBM Watson API.

* Now that the coding bootcamp grind is over,  FinTech.O! meetups resume next month, April 8th.   We have a great lineup of speakers for you. Watch the FinTech.O! space for more details.
results.name: AI & Bots: Marc's graduating from Coding Bootcamp! *

results.description:
Hyatt Place is a new hotel in downtown Flushing, located just a block away from the Main St. stop of the 7 train.  It is also accessible via every bus line that goes though Flushing (Q20, Q44, Q25, Q34, Q27, Q17, Q65, Q48, Q13, Q28, Q16, Q58, Q12, Q66, Q19, Q50, Q15, Q26).

We mostly play newer "euro" style board games (Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan are among the oldest) that often run 1.5 to 3.0 hours. If you arrive while games are going on, prepare to hang out and chat while they finish up then organize for a new game.

We are permitted to bring food into the lobby, but EVERYONE MUST BUY AT LEAST 1 THING FROM THE BAR, AND TIP THE BARTENDER VERY WELL. The venue we are using is a business and we want them to be glad to have us there.


Please keep noise level down to a minimum to avoid distracting the hotel guests and clean up after yourselves (the trash area is just a few feet away).

The card keys for the bathrooms are available from the front desk.  As a courtesy, please check to see if anyone else in the group needs to use the keys before returning them to the front desk.

results.description: Everyone raved about the vegetable extravaganza at Dovetail—the creativity on display in each course was a true standout. So we’re keen to try another vegetable-focused chef's rendering of fruits, seeds, roots, tubers, bulbs, stems, and leaves from the plant kingdom! For our next vegetarian adventure we’ve chosen Dirt Candy—chef/owner Amanda Cohen’s award-winning vegetable restaurant on the Lower East Side. Cohen chose the edgy name because, for her, vegetables are “candy from the dirt.” Dirt Candy was the first vegetarian restaurant in 17 years to receive two stars from The New York Times. It was recognized by Michelin Guide five years in a row and has won awards from Gourmet Magazine, The Village Voice, and many others. Amanda Cohen was the first vegetarian chef to compete on Iron Chef America. Her comic, graphic-novel cookbook, Dirt Candy: A Cookbook, is currently in its fourth printing.
results.name: Vegetarian at Dirt Candy

results.description:
Prepayment @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5999

is required 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

Prepayment @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5999

**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


30-$35 depending on how early you register.
results.name: Speed POOL (Billiards)- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

is required 

------------------------------------------------ 
WHAT: Speed POOL (BILLIARDS) for Singles 

WHERE: Society Billiards & bar 
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works

Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of two or three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have someone to sign up with. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle  and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.


Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool OR play for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game will win a prize. 

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next pool table and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


Answer: You will have a scorecard to fill out after each round. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

30-$35 depending on how early you register.

results.description:
活动收取门票$5每人。到场并参与游戏的请准备$5现金，刷卡$6。请在入场时交付并登记姓名 （定期有特殊优惠)。只观战不参与游戏的，不需要交费。晚到或提前退场但参与游戏的，门票价钱一样$5。

---------------------------------------------------------

如果你玩过杀人游戏或狼人杀，却还没听过阿瓦隆，那我不得不说您有点out啦！

与狼人杀相似，阿瓦隆也是一款角色扮演加逻辑推理游戏，玩家扮演不同身份，在辩驳之中分辨好人坏人。与狼人杀不同的是，玩家人数为5 - 10人，每一位玩家都能够参与到游戏最后，不存在被杀被票死就只能干看别人玩的情景。

这个游戏考验玩家的逻辑分析能力以及彼此的信任度，是一款绝对不会让你失望的游戏！如果您没有玩过这款游戏也不用担心，游戏规则很简单5分钟就可以学会，即便您对此游戏一无所知来参加我们活动也没关系。

玩家人数达到5人即举办活动，游戏时间3月11日6:30pm - 9:30pm。如果人数多，会开两桌或组织升级等其他游戏。地点在距离Penn Station步行五分钟的XYZ IMPRESSION Studio。地址：470 7th Ave, Suite 410, New York, NY 10018. 由于游戏受玩家人数影响，请大家尽量早到5 - 10分钟，不要迟到，6:30pm准时开始介绍游戏规则。

报名请RSVP并将姓名，Email，电话私信(message)给Lisa Yu.

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. 

When: Fridays 6:30pm-7:30pm.  Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbies

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)
results.name: Meditate, Rest & Recharge

group.name: "Art of Living" NYC- Making Life a Celebration

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hang-out for Buddhists (& like minded)

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Den här månaden träffas vi på en restaurant eller krog med bra läge på Manhattan eller Brooklyn. När meetup-platsen är bestämd kommer du att få e-post med platsdetaljer.

Om du vill komma på vår Happy Hour så registrera dig gärna på väntelistan! Om du kan delta i samtal på svenska eller norska utan att prata på engelska, så är möjligheten väldigt stor att du kommer få en plats. (Vårt mål är att inte prata engelska innan kl 8.30 pm.) 

Observera att de flesta i gruppen är antingen svenskar eller norrmän, eller personer som talar svenska eller norska, så om du kommer för att få tala danska, så var beredd på att det troligtvis inte är så många danskar där. 


Eftersom vi pratar svenska, norska och danska på vara träffar antas bara medlemmar som har åtminstone grundläggande kunskaper i något av de skandinaviska språken.

Vänligen OSA respektfullt. Vi är en verklig grupp av vänner och våra etikettsregler återspeglar detta. Om du inser att du inte kan komma, vilket är helt ok, så se till att du uppdaterar din OSA.

YOU MUST PREPAY FOR THIS EVENT USING THE LINK IN THE EVENT DESCRIPTION.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those registered. There will be over 50 people participating.  If you have any questions please contact the event host Dave Cervini at [masked].

Love art? Hate art? Just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because you're sure to have fun with our MOMA Scavenger Hunt. 

There is no better way to go see this  artwork than with dozens of new friends!  You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, have picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at Old Castle Pub for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle Pub for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT - PURCHASE TICKETS HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/moma-scavenger-hunt-cocktails-tickets-22341121897

Time: Registration: 6pm-6:30pm

Each team will have one hour to complete the hunt.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time

Can I come alone?  Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We'll team you up with other fun people. 

What's included? ($15) 
- Scavenger Hunt Admission 

- A fun way to visit the museum

- A unique way to make friends

-Private room rental for registration and after hunt reception

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network

PREPAY ONLY EVENT - PURCHASE TICKETS HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/moma-scavenger-hunt-cocktails-tickets-22341121897

results.description:
It doesn't matter if you've played pool before or not. This is a fun and different way to make new friends and maybe find that someone special. 

Mix & mingle before playing pool with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

This event will sell out quickly (especially for MEN) so get your tickets ASAP:

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/sFn0Do

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/tuhX35

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.   

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each pool table. This male and female team will play one game of pool or for a maximum of 15 minutes. Which ever team wins the game wins a prize.  

At the end of the game or 15 minutes, the ladies will stay at the same pool table. The male team will rotate to the next  table and the process begins again. We will continue for two hours or until you have met everyone. 

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address.

What's included:

• Free Pool Games    

• Scorecard Matching  

• Ice Breakers 

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase: 

WOMEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/sFn0Do

MEN get tickets here - https://goo.gl/tuhX35

Prepay Only Event. No tix sold at door. Must buy in advance.   

This is a multi-Meetup, non-ethnic specific event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Up to 40 singles will be attending. Ages will mostly be 20s-40s. Food and drink will be available for purchase.
results.name: Singles Pool Night - PREPAY ONLY EVENT

results.description:
Join us for knitting, weaving crocheting, good pastries and great coffee. Soft instruction for beginner knitters and weavers will be offered by Janna. So, if you're a newbie Janna will be happy to introduce you to the basics or make you more comfortable with what you already knowL

Many people come just hang out and knit. Feel free to come with any other craft too.

Feel free to ask me questions about what supplies to bring by commenting below or messaging Janna Maria Vallee.

PnP would love to see/support your progress at other meetups throughout the month!
results.how_to_find_us: there are two different Kaffe 1668s in the area make sure you're going to the right one. We will be downstairs at the long table.
results.name: Crafting at Kaffe 1668 with free beginner knitting and weaving instruction

results.description:
Ok, I have been trying for couple month to get reservation for this restaurant on weekend,after couple month trying  I finally able to get for 3/11 for our group ! 

I love the decor of this place and of course the all you can eat hotpot. Bring you a very special experience of Chinese food.


Shall we try it together?

Cost= $32 per person weekend price cash only ( Including tax, Tips and meet up fee) 

• Cash Only. Very important!!! Makes everyone's life easier...


• Serious RSVP only. Do not RSVP if you're not certain.

• "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated.

• We are going to eat Family Style, each person orders from a list and every individual is responsible to pay their own drinks.

• Cash Only. Very Important!!! Makes everyone's life easier...

• Do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above.

•  Most restaurant only keep reservation for 15 minutes, so if you are late for more than 15 minutes,The restaurant might take the seat away ( I will do my best to keep it for you , but if restaurant insist there is nothing I can do about it )  so try to be on time please. Thank You. 

Hot Pot History
The Chinese hot pot has a history of more than 1,000 years.[1] Hot pot seems to have originated in Mongolia and the Jin Dynasty where the main ingredient was meat, usually beef, mutton or horse. It then spread to southernChina during the Song Dynasty and was further established during the Mongolian Yuan Dynasty.[1] In time, regional variations developed with different ingredients such as seafood. By the Qing Dynasty (AD 1644 to 1912), the hot pot became popular throughout most of China. Today in many modern homes, particularly in larger cities, the traditional coal-heated steamboat or hot pot has been replaced by electric, propane, butane gas, orinduction cooker versionsa
results.name: All you can eat Hot Pot @ 99 Favor Taste

group.name: ! New York Ethnic Food Lovers and activities

results.description:
A lot of the ppl that show up to the meetup on Fridays usually DO NOT RSVP. So if anyone is interested in attending please do not get scared away as this meetup is always running and always have enough to get a few games going. Do not hesitate to RSVP or just show up as most do. Thanks

b>Friday Night Futsal

Please wear futsal/indoor shoes or regular flat bottom sneakers.


$10 for one hour or $15 for two hours per player!!

NOT ALLOWED:

-Slide Tackles

-Unnecessary Contact

-Unnecessary Trash Talk


We are here to enjoy the game not to argue or fight!


Once you RSVP please show up!!


Please feel free to contact me with any questions you may have :)

**By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit to participate in this game. You voluntarily release NYC Futbol from any and all liability resulting from your participation and/or receipt of instruction.
results.how_to_find_us: The entrance is on the corner of Baltic Street and 4th Avenue in Brooklyn.  Gym is on the 3rd Floor

results.description:
Get Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/wine-tasting-event-nyc.html

We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.

"Mingle & Taste 15 Wines From All Around The World!"
Join us for a festive Wine tasting and mingle with fellow upscale NYC professionals where you will get to taste 15 wines in a fun, relaxed environment. There will be red and white wines for all around the world along with delicious cheeses. Detailed instructions on how the wine was made with each pour!. Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring a friend. Expect more than 25 people (mostly singles) to attend. This is not an age specific event. Anyone friendly and interested in mingling and tasting great wine may attend.

* THIS IS A MULTI MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THIS EVENT IS BEING LISTED ON OVER 15 DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUPS. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL EVENT ATTENDEES.

Also enjoy complimentary cheeses & crudités!

When: Friday, March 11th: 6:30 - 8:30 PM (You can arrive as early as 6:15 to check-in)
Where: "Some Good Wine" (13 E 8th St, New York, NY - between 5th Ave and University Pl)

POST WINE TASTING MINGLE! After the wine tasting ends we will be inviting all attendees to stroll down the street to a nearby bar so we can continue to mingle. We will be announcing the venue where this will be held during the wine tasting event.

Get Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/wine-tasting-event-nyc.html

FAQ: How many people will be attending? We usually have between 25 and 40 people at this event.

What us the dress code? The dress code is "neat, casual or trendy". Basically just don't wear gym attire. What you wear to work is likely perfect.

Can I come alone? Yes 75% attending typically come on their own... some people bring a friend or 2.

Is this event social? Yes! What makes this event great is that a lot of socializing goes on and the vibe is very laid back and friendly.

Do I need to know about wine? Absolutely not... Most come to learn and to socialize.

What is the age range? This is not for a specific age range. We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang out and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance? Yes. Space is limited and this event will sell out so grab your ticket as early as possible.

Get Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/wine-tasting-event-nyc.html

We recommend getting your tickets as far in advance as possible because this event often sells out! As an incentive to get your ticket early, we will be raising the ticket price every few days. The price will be as high as $49 by the event time.
results.name: Wine Tasting Event - Wine, Cheese & Mingle

Three teams rotating since indoor is a fast game. Every 7 minutes or 3 goals we switch out, no team can play more than twice in a row.

Please wear a white shirt. We will have a red team, a green team, and a white team.

If you are a NO SHOW, you will be REMOVED from our Meetup group.

results.description:
Advertised as the 100th production of American International studios, Blacula stars actor/singerWilliam Marshall in the title role. An 18th century African prince, Blacula is transmogrified into a vampire while visiting Transylvania. Two centuries later, he rises from his coffin to wreak havoc in the Watts district of Los Angeles. Blacula's particular target is Tina (Vonetta McGee), whom he thinks is the reincarnation of his long-ago lady love. Thalmus Rasulala assumes the "Van Helsing" role as the vampire hunter who can't convince the authorities to cooperate. Yes, that is the same William Marshallwho later played "The King of Cartoons" on TV's Pee-wee's Playhouse. A sequel, Scream, Blacula, Scream!, appeared not long after.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V8Sfrhj5IP4
results.how_to_find_us: we will meet in the lobby call/text my cell 917-388-5838
results.name: Blacula 35mm film print movie starts at 7pm

Two bronzed beauties (Nichole and Monica) with flowers weaved in their hair and petals spread on the floor. Let's get creative with this editorial photoshoot! 

**Nichole is a professional makeup artist and stylist. Her normal rates are $200+/hour so this is a HUGE DISCOUNT!! Nichole will be modeling as well as doing hair/makeup.

INSPIRATION PICTURES:

**note: models featured will NOT be the models for this event. Nichole did the hair and makeup for this photoshoot.

ACTUAL MODELS: Nichole (left) & Monica (right)

LOCATION:

We booked a studio with multiple background options (pics below - brick, rug, wood floor, wood tabletop, etc.)! Nichole will be bringing white studio grade lighting (very flattering to the face, link below), but feel free to bring your own lights!

http://lashjoy.com.au/glamcor-classic-elite-ultra-light-new-model/ 

PRICE:

$50 + $9 booking fee = $59 per photographer

1.5 hours, 2 models

*

Dance Party & Social

*

Friday, March 11

Essex County

*

Early Bird Online Ticket Sale see below 

*

The Place to be Seen!

Over 150 are expected.

*

Cha Cha Dance Instruction

Registration 6:30pm - Instruction 7pm - 8pm (optional)

Meet and Greet7:15pm

Friday Dance Party & Social8pm to Midnight

The Manor - Dôme Nightclub

click venue name above for directions

111 Prospect Avenue West Orange, NJ 07052

*

THE EVENT

*

Cha Cha Dance Instruction(optional)

by Matt

Registration 6:30pm --- Instruction 7:00pm - 8:00pm

Over 30 individuals at the dance instruction, a great icebreaker as you change partners! Meet 120 more happy faces at the Dance and Social.

No partner needed. Tonight's class is for Beginners and Intermediate level dancers. Accomplished dancers are always welcome to polish their skills and to meet new faces..

*

Friday Dance Party & Social

8:00pm to Midnight.

"Mix, Mingle and Dance" in The Dôme Nightclub. The DJ will be taking requests and spinning the hottest dance tracks all night long! You just might meet that special person! .

Everyone welcome, expected median Age 55. Introduce your friends to PBSN tonight in an elegant and sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere.

*

Cash bar. Sip a thirst quenching drink and dance the night away with new friends!

*

PROPER ATTIRE

Dress to Impress. The Manor requests business attire, jackets are preferred. Please, no jeans, no sneakers, no shorts, no t-shirts.

*

No reservation is required.

Groups, Guests, Friends, and Walk-ins are always welcome.

Membership is not required.

*

COST

*

$20 admission at the door

...OR...

$13 by 3/10 with purchase of tickets thru Eventbrite<--- Click for details

*

( All admission fees include attending optional Instruction, Meet & Greet and Dance )

*

The Dôme, originally designed for but never integrated into the White House during the Benjamin Harrison administration [masked]), was adapted for The Manor and added to the West Orange landmark in 1975. 

*

Experience the grandeur of the new two story foyer and spiral Stairway on your way up to the Dôme Nightclub

* 

 PBSNinfo.com - home page 

*

results.description:
In this edition of AstroAnswers, AAA Board Member Jason Kendall will describe them briefly and how they are formed. He’ll go into the details of the press release by the Laser Interferometric Gravitational Wave Observatory (LIGO). This is astonishing news, and it has opened up a new way of learning about the universe.

Where: American Museum of Natural History – Kaufmann Theatre (enter on 77th st.)
When: Friday, March 11th, 2016; 6:30pm – 8:30pm

Astro Answers is free for AAA members, $10 for non-members.
(Another great reason to become a member!)

Pre-registration is required for ALL members and non-members. Event registration here!

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/astro-answers-gravitational-waves-what-are-they-tickets-22281980002

About the speaker:
Jason Kendall is an Adjunct Prof. of Astronomy and Astronomy Liaison with William Paterson University in Wayne, New Jersey. Jason’s graduate research was in General Relativity and Cosmology, and he’s given numerous talks about the Big Bang, Black Holes for the AAA and around the region.

*This is not an AMNH event. This event is organized and run by the AAA
results.name: Astro Answers – Gravitational Waves: What are they?

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Tell the truth: You know that you are brilliant…at least in some moments or about some things. But that reality gets eclipsed by the internal dialogue that doubts whether you have done it right, said it right, are good enough, and questions whether you will ever live up to your potential – the conversation that complains about the smallest of things, especially and including how you are going about your life. Until you discover how to consistently disengage from this conversation, you will not be able to master the expression of your brilliance.

This course is designed to free you from that internal chatter so that you can indeed discover the incredible being that you are. It is devoted to allowing you to step into your brilliance, not just occasionally, not just when you feel secure – but all of the time. This course is for anyone who wants to experience and express their brilliance as a lifestyle, moment-to-moment, rather than being stuck in memories of the past or worries about the future. This seminar will empower and enable you to create possibilities that heretofore did not exist.

Dates: Friday, March 11 – Sunday, March 13, 2016
Time: Friday: 7 – 10pm, Saturday & Sunday: 9:45am – 6:00pm
Fee: $475


To Register:

https://www.transformationmadeeasy.com/product/step-into-your-brilliance-475/

results.name: Step into Your Brilliance with Ariel & Shya Kane

results.description:
All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

(6:30pm reception - light refreshments) suggested donation $5 members, $10 non-members

Ethics and the Theater will present a play reading of Other Desert Cities, by Jon Robin Baitz.

Brooke is visiting her parents, and she has brought with her the manuscript of her latest book, a memoir that tells of a painful family event. They spar over whether it should be published, and the havoc it might wreak in all their lives.

Matt Antar Bonnie Bean Carole Chamlin Pat Debrovner Natalie Kropf Tom Weishaar

Directed by Susan Horowitz 

Come at 6:30 pm for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.

results.name: Shamanic Open Circle and celebration of Spirit

results.description:
Please join us for a screening of The Paw Project at Hunter College.
Exact location: West faculty Lounge 8th floor.

We are very happy to announce our special guests:


Assemblywoman Linda Rosenthal, who has introduced a bill (Assembly Bill A1297) to ban declawing in the state of New York.
http://assembly.state.ny.us/mem/Linda-B-Rosenthal/

Susan Whittred, DVM and Allan Simon, DVM the NY co-directors of the Paw Project.
http://www.pawproject.org/

For years in this country, cats have been subjected to being declawed. Propagated as a painless, cosmetic medical procedure what was in fact being done was amputation.

Though declawing has been banned in many countries around the world, the practice has not been outlawed by the American Veterinary Medical Association. 95% of these amputations are performed to protect the cat owner's furniture.
Meanwhile, no one was gathering information on the cats' post-surgical discomfort and subsequant behavioral problems.

Fortunately, Dr. Jennifer Connrad DVM started gathering the medical evidence, took legislative action and started a movement to declawing in America. This film tells the story of her work to save cats.

http://www.pawprojectmovie.com/


https://vimeo.com/73700746

We're also asking that everyone who attends this evening please bring a can of cat food or make a small donation to our friend and featured rescuer: Paul "The Cat Guy" Santell who operates in Astoria, Queens and has done an amazing job saving the lives of countless homeless cats and kittens.
https://www.facebook.com/paulthecatguy

Thanks to P.A.L Path to Animals Liberation for supporting the event at Hunter College. https://www.facebook.com/hunterpals

This is an evening all about helping our beloved felines. We hope you can join us. Vegan refreshments will be served.
results.name: The Animals' Battalion presents: The Paw Project

results.description:
As a Makerspace with an educational mission, we have always been striving to deliver the best educational content and reach the most number of people who are ready to learn and grow. 

I want to help MakerBar Members and community members who have skills they want to share structure their ideas into real and practical classes that will teach people these skills effectively. 

In this session I'll help you: 

-Create a crystal clear vision for what a technology class can be at MakerBar, or anywhere else where tech education is your mission, and build your first class 

-Uncover hidden challenges that are sabotaging your ability and confidence to teach the valuable skills and knowledge you have to others 

-Leave your session feeling renewed, re-energized, and inspired to finally schedule that awesome class you've been dreaming about! 

This session is free for Makerbar members.

What you WON'T need: 

You don't need to have a class idea. I will show you how to consistently generate new ideas, and how to narrow down huge lists of ideas to the few that will work. 

You won't need to have any teaching experience. I will also show you tested strategies to make your preparation fun and effective, and teach you to crush the fears of teaching a group by channeling your inner MakerBarbarian. (Preparation crushes Trepidation!) 

You won't need a PhD in quantum physics, rocket science, brain surgery (Or is that an MD?), or any sort of advanced impressive credentials (Though we certainly welcome you if you have them!). I'll show you how to find skills you already have that other people would want to learn and how to put them into the form of a class that can help them learn from your knowledge. 

You won't need 42.75 hours a week to devote to class preparation, writing, emailing, marketing, etc. I'll show you how to work around your busy schedule to put together great classes and plan your entire advertising campaign and automate everything; and retain this information so that the class can be run over and over with minimal effort the next times. 

What you WILL need: 

- Your laptop or tablet (Recommended)
- An open mind
- Your thinking cap (only joking; but come ready to stretch your idea muscle) 

Join me and together let’s build more awesome classes and workshops to feed this new age of makers, hackers, hobbyists, professionals, enthusiasts and tinkerers more essential skills, more awesome projects, and help open them and inspire them to achieve more than they thought they ever could! 

See you there!
results.name: MakerBar Class Building Workshop

Learn to act while overcoming stage fright. Meet new people and increase your confidence and poise. 10-session program. Scene Work - Improvisation - Monologue Study - Showcase Performance opportunities.

The focus is on relaxation and natural performance based on sound fundamental acting technique. We also provide the unique opportunity to perform before live audiences in our own in-house showcase productions.

Acting programs are often very intimidating. The instructors are harsh and anxiety is not addressed. We offer a more humane and effective alternative. Our program is designed to empower as well as guide you through the acting experience.

Many people who attend our classes have never acted before and just need a supportive environment to try it out. We work in very manageable steps. You will not be asked to do anything you are not comfortable with.

Please do come in and see for yourself, if the program is right for you.

Initial session is free of charge. If you do decide to enroll at the

OPENS MARCH 11 -  VILLAGE EAST CINEMA


Click Here To Buy Tickets


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7XtnZDNXCKM

Website:

http://boombustclick.com/

Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/boombustclick

Twitter:

https://twitter.com/BoomBustClick

</a><a href="https://www.citycinemas.com/villageeast/film/boom-bust-boom">Click Here To Buy Tickets


"If the 2008 crisis didn't wake people up, I don't know what will." *– Actor activist, John Cusack* "..highly amusing and highly informative breakdown of just what the hell is wrong with the global economy." – flickfilosopher Synopsis: Can we change an unstable economic system? Can we adapt economics to human nature? Terry Jones’ (Monty Python) new feature documentary BOOM BUST BOOM shows the link between our unstable economy and how economics is taught. A mix of live action, animation, puppetry and song, BOOM BUST BOOM charts the ancient cycle of boom and bust and offers the world a solution.

BOOM BUST BOOM opens theatrically in US on March 11 at The Village East Cinema in New York, followed by a release on iTunes and On Demand March 15.

A timely call to action, BOOM BUST BOOM investigates the worldwide economic crash of 2008, and how we can avoid another global collapse in the future. Analyzing the direct link between the unstable financial system and our reliance on mainstream economics, the film puts a spotlight on the mistakes of the past some politicians and central bankers would like us to forget.

BOOM BUST BOOM also features high profile advocates for change such as John Cusack, journalists Paul Mason and John Cassidy plus leading experts including the Chief Economist of the Bank of England, Andy Haldane, and Nobel Prize winners Daniel Kahneman, Robert Shiller and Paul Krugman. Boom Bust Boom is a platform for conversation - can we change our unstable system? The documentary is a result of a meeting between writer, director, historian and Python Jones and economics professor and entrepreneur Theo Kocken,

BOOM BUST BOOM is co-written by Jones and Kocken and co-directed by Jones with son Bill Jones and Ben Timlett, AKA Bill & Ben Productions. Drawing on their respective talents, the Boom Bust Project combines Terry Jones' unique comedy and Theo Kocken's detailed expertise, making finance more interesting than it’s ever been before.
results.name: Special Movie Night - *BOOM BUST BOOM* - OPENS MARCH 11 - VILLAGE EAST CINEMA

results.description:
This evening will focus on two themes useful to anybody. Like electricity during a storm, our emotions can sometimes wreak havoc on our lives. The energy body can scatter all over during one's day--  here, there and everywhere a person’s attention goes. This is not so much fun and a less than helpful way to experience life.


Centering is a way of simply returning all of one’s energy back to home base, to the core vessel that is you. It’s a way of mentally compacting oneself around a person’s mental or spiritual center of gravity.

Grounding connects one’s energy body to the healing, nurturing and stabilizing effect of the earth’s energy.  Grounding is especially useful to empaths as well as anyone interested in more advanced spiritual practices such as energy healing, mediumship or psychic development. The deeper one's roots, the higher one's reach into the cosmic realm.

This evening’s session will include a brief meditation, discussion and experiential exercises.

Cost $15. Please pay the facilitator directly.

results.description:
Love in the City is a 1953 Italian anthology “of great historical significance…the founding work of cinéma vérité” (J. Hoberman). 

The film is composed of six segments each with its own writer and director:

Paid Love written and directed by Carlo Lizzani
Attempted Suicide by Michelangelo Antonioni
Paradise for Three Hours by Dino Risi
Marriage Agency by Federico Fellini
Story of Catarina by Cesare Zavattini and Umberto Maselli
Italians Stare written and directed by Alberto Lattuada

About Cabaret Cinema: Emotions/Emoticons

As a companion to the Brainwave series, Cabaret Cinema will screen nine classic films that are driven by nine emotions. Notable introducers will help the audience to understand the importance of the given emotion to the film’s narrative. 

Can it be more cultural than this to spend Friday night at the museum watching old films related to love and emotions? ;) Join us!

Admission is free on Friday Nights. There's a guided tour from 7-7:45pm. If you haven't been to the museum, the tour would be great to join.  We will grab a drink/bite after that!

*For the film, ticket should be purchased here. https://tickets.rubinmuseum.org/public/auto_choose_ga.asp?area=20

Looking forward to seeing you there!

Barnes in Think and Grow Rich and flew to Los Angeles where Bob Proctor was leading his seminar based on his best-selling book, You Were Born Rich.  Richard walked up to Bob, extended his hand and introduced himself saying that he wanted to learn to think the way that Bob thinks… and so began what has become a close mentorship and friendship between Bob and Richard.

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/
results.how_to_find_us: We meet at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center in Bayside, Queens. We convene in the Community Room.
results.name: Friday Night Boardgaming in Bayside Queens!

results.description:
Founded as a trio in the early 1990’s and blossoming into a 5 piece
band in the late 90’s, Wonderous Stories has snowballed into one
of the top drawing bands on Long Island.
The band plays regularly in the summer at Long Islands top outdoor venues
as well as large venues in New York City. In the cold weather they pack popular
clubs. They are no strangers to playing full albums and album sides
by the likes of, “Yes”, “The Who”, “Genesis” ,”Pink Floyd”, “The
Beatles”, “Paul McCartney”, ”Traffic”, ”CSNY” and more! Unless
they are playing an entire album, you never know what you’re going to hear because
they don’t know what they’re going to play! Most of the time Wonderous Stories
works without a setlist and is always willing to try something new.... even without
a net!
  Their influences also include,Moody Blues, JethroTull,Badfinger,David Bowie,
Elton John,Led Zep,ELP,Bruce Springstein, Allman Brothers and more.
The audience is always amazed at the wide variety of rock classics they play with
accuracy and with virtual ease.
“Wonderous Stories has to
be the most talented “cover”
band that I’ve ever seen.”
– Goodtimes Magazine
results.how_to_find_us: Come early help save seats!
results.name: " Wonderous Stories "

results.description:
THE PERSONALITY COUNTDOWN GAME


To feel successful and achieve more, you have to be able to become aware of all of you. There is a magnetic force called your personality that both attracts and repels opportunities around you. Join the NEW level for working beyond personal weakness while building up your strengths. The next level of intra-social intelligence for rapidly upgrading your life. You will find new energy to take home and maybe new friends to keep. A great place to meet NEW people different from yourself and like minded people.


Are you still trying to date the wrong personalities?

Why can't your boss get you?

What bothers you about your last significant others?

Do your friends think you are a genius or the lovable clown?

Is it easy for you to find love?

Why do you get along with certain people at work or on a date?

How come you can complete certain projects and other never get started?

Why do certain ways of doing things tick you off?

Why do other methods of doing things fill you with happiness?

Do others understand you?


NOT ANOTHER ZOMBIE LECTURE

PLAY THE ROOM SIZE FAST & FUN ACTION GAME 


NO BORING PEN AND PAPER TEST OR ZOMBIE LECTURE! You will play in a room sized GAME SHOW. The Curator will provide Clues to help each person discover their many "FLOWING PERSONALITIES." Are you surprised to hear you have many personalities? Learn about some of your personalities by playing a giant room size game. Who are you at work,home, while shopping, last week or today? Playing the game will provide each attendee the rare opportunity to know some of their many personalities. Take a GIANT LEAP beyond self-help and land in self-evolution on steroids.

Demystify divorce and Internet dating

Reduce tensions inside of yourself while finding what makes you happy

The secret to stop fighting yourself around getting the important things done

Find Rocking, fun, caring relationships offline and online

Discover where both your bad and good habits or motivations originate

Become More focus on your goals,dreams and what you want to attract

Attend to gain new insights into yourself and others

 Find out the source of sudden changes in your and others behavior

Understand the source of both your weakness and strengths 

$10.00 online $15.00 at the door

THE PERSONALITY COUNTDOWN GAME

FRIDAY March 11


Time 7:30 pm To 10:00 pm

Location: Ripley-Grier 520 8th Avenue 17 FL 

Between 36th and 37th street New York, NY 10018 

Please be on time, allow for traffic and delays in your travel plans.


Take the Right Hand side elevator to the 17 Floor

Walk though the glass doors and turn left and at the end turn right then left to the end of the hall


NOTE: If there is a ROOM CHANGE consult the front desk.

Room: 17 M


WHO SHOULD ATTEND And BENEFIT?

Entrepreneurs, Running a Start up, Artists, Writers,Self-employed, educators, managers & executives, or Salespersons. Anyone and everyone with beliefs and those who communicate with others that have beliefs. Someone that wants more FREEDOM, CREATIVITY AND ACHIEVEMENT in their lives. 


CURATOR


The Cognitive Artist & Stylist James Murdock operates a boutique-consulting and coaching practice. The primary focus of the practice is providing training in Human performance engineering and organizational development. He is a cultural trends tracker, communication skills and persuasion expert. Mr. Murdock is an independent researcher in the areas of cognitive Science, Human Behavior Engineering and accelerated Human change. His work has been featured both nationally and internationally in media ranging from Marie Claire magazine, ABC news, NBC news, The Gayle King Show, Spotlight magazine, Providence journal, New York press, The British Star, Manhattan Spirit, and New York Non-Stop, plus numerous National Radio programs. He has also written for many national and regional publications.
results.name: LIVE EXHIBITION: THE PERSONALITY COUNTDOWN GAME

results.description:
You can register at Blue Moon, Port Washington, (516) 883-2800. 

Option 1: Dance-Meditations®, a mindful movement practice in which movement and imagery blend as restorative meditations and expressions in motion, incorporating elements of a variety of movement/meditation practices such as Qi Kung, Yoga, Breath-work and more. First class is Thursdays, March 17, at 9:30 AM. 

Option two: Shake Your Soul®, a blended and seamless whole of spirited movement of African, modern, and expressive dance. Friday mornings, 9:30 AM, begins March 18th.

Trial class, sample both, Friday, March 11 at 7:30 PM. Join this fun dance party to launch our meetup!

Try one, try them all. Refreshments will be served before the evening classes. Exercise/yoga attire and barefoot. Classes are appropriate for all, no children please. Previous dance or meditation experience not necessary.

Location for all classes are at Blue Moon , 194 Main St, Port Washington, NY 11050; (516) 883-2800. Your facilitator is yours truly, Catherine Braun, movement/dance therapist.
For more information, please visit mind-body-in-motion.com, FB - Mind Body In Motion, or call 516.639.9171.

Looking forward to moving with you, Catherine
results.name: Come alive and connect to life's restorative motion with Dance/Movement Therapy.

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Friday Night? This event Friday night is for men and women at Darbar Grill.  

At present we need men and only men (aged 35 to 45 although there's a little flexibility in the age range). Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.  

The theme tonight is advanced degree singles (i.e. MBA, JD, Master's etc.. Please note the theme when signing up).

Grab friends and come along to Darbar Grill to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me (i.e. from [masked]) ; also tickets are free for a limited time but at anytime you can register at the New York EasyDates website for $25 with promo code MEETUP-25.  

If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

Regards, 

Daniel
results.name: email danielb1035@gmail.com

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7, it's a  60min + game and coed friendly.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis on passing over dribbling.


4) If there are no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP w/ payment. This goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Friday Soccer 7v7 COED @7:30pm | W. Village 60min+

results.description:
By now, I think most people know that Over 40 Fun Loving Singles includes just about everyone. You don't have to be single.  The only prerequisite is that you act in a mature and responsible manner and like to have fun.

I've been hearing from both single men and women that they are trying to hook up with someone special.  So, I've decided to have BOWLING BUDDY HOOKUP!  Designed for single people who are looking to bowl...and meet someone special. 

Here's the plan:

- Bring a member of the opposite sex that you are not interested in dating to bowl. That's pretty much it.  We want to make sure that we have an even number of men and women. 

- If you do not have someone that you can bring bowling...maybe there's someone that knows several members of the opposite sex and they can bring additional people.

- Maybe you've gone online and met someone that you're not interested in but they may be good for someone else...bring them.

This is a great way to meet new people and possibly someone special. 

This is not going to be a heavy emphasis on hooking up.  We are going to have a good time bowling.  I am going still going to maintain my high score status.  This is simply a vehicle that you can use to meet new people.  Hey, I'm trying to help out!

Hope you can please join us for Buddy Bowling!

THE FEE IS ROUGHLY $20-$25 FOR BOWILING AND SHOES!!!
results.name: Bowling Buddies Bash!

group.name: Over 40 Fun Loving Singles in New Jersey

results.description:
Ho'Oponopono: Divine Healing From Hawaiian Shamans

With Dr.  Jay Kantor

We can appeal to Divinity who knows our personal blueprint, for healing of all thoughts and memories that are holding us back at this time, It is a matter of going beyond traditional means of accessing knowledge about ourselves.
The process that Morna Simeona refers to is based on the ancient Hawaiian method of stress reduction (release) and problem solving called Ho'oponopono. The word Ho'oponopono means to make right, to rectify an error.  How does ho’oponono work?

We are the sum total of our experiences, which is to say that we are burdened by our pasts. When we experience stress or fear in our lives, if we would look carefully, we would find that the cause is actually a memory. It is the emotions which are tied to these memories which affect us now. The subconscious associates an action or person in the present with something that happened in the past. When this occurs, emotions are activated and stress is produced."
The main purpose of this process is to discover the Divinity within oneself. The Ho'oponopono is a profound gift which allows one to develop a working relationship with the Divinity within and learn to ask that in each moment, our errors in thought, word, deed or action be cleansed. The process is essentially about freedom, complete freedom from the past.

Join us for information and experience with this amazing healing process.

The program will be facilitated by Dr. Jay Kantor - http://DrJayKantor.Com .
results.name: Ho'Oponopono: Divine Healing From Hawaiian Shamans With Dr.  Jay Kantor

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!
