results.description:
Our spring film series consists of four classic films of Black Cinema and leads off with Lost Boundaries,  an extraordinary Hollywood release from 1949 that is now largely forgotten. 

The film is based on the true story of Dr. Albert C. Johnston and his family who passed for white in a small New England town in the 30s and 40s.  

 Amazingly, Dr. Johnston and his wife didn't even tell their kids!!!  Though it's stylistically dated by modern standards and does take some liberties with the real facts (especially with the son's reaction to the news that he was "a negro"), this movie was groundbreaking in 1949 and pulls no punches with themes that still resonate in 2016.

Among its honors is that the cities of Atlanta and Memphis banned it ("We don't take that kind of picture here." said the Memphis board of censors!)

From a 1949 Ebony magazine article:

Heralded by its producers as 'a story that is certain to make motion picture history for its daring, for its dramatic impact, for its truth, Lost Boundaries ...[is a ]...remarkable documentary chronicle of a Negro family that "passed'"for two decades in a small New England town.  For the most part the film lives up to its advance billing. Not only is the picture exciting entertainment on a provocative theme but its script is also a fairly faithful dramatic translation of the book...

$5 suggested donation at the door


Discussion will follow

Light snacks included

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup includes Rob Magnotti (Comedy Central), DC Benny (Comedy Central, Last Comic Standing), Dante Nero, Greer Barnes (HBO). Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BtXAmfgkGLI

Come out this Friday and help me celebrate getting older.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
BAMcafe is probably my favorite place in all of NYC to listen to live music. It's one of the most visually attractive spaces in the City, and possesses an atmosphere that just puts you in the mood to be entertained. The artists are always amazing- featuring either up and coming acts or those who've made it and want to play a more intimate venue. Even the crowd that attends usually adds something special by interacting with the artist to create an involved listening experience. And best of all, It's free. Yep, I said it- 100% free. You can't beat that with a stick. Or maybe you can. I don't know- I'm not that familiar with sticks. Anyway, If you want to enjoy good music with good company, all in an amazing space, join us at BAMcafe.

Here's some info about the artist from the BAMcafe website:

This acclaimed, forward-thinking string quartet has been shaking up the city’s classical music scene, emphasizing a repertoire of new works by emerging artists. PUBLIQuartet showcases daring contemporary pieces and original compositions that incorporate jazz, world music, and electronic influences. Fresh from their sold-out debut at Carnegie Hall, they take the stage at BAMcafé for a genre-busting evening of cutting-edge classical music.


 I recommend you check out their website, here, and listen to some of their songs to get an idea of this unique and interesting group- and to get an idea why I'm excited for their performance. 

One last thing to keep in mind, the space isn't tiny, but it has been known to fill up quickly in the past. Getting there on time or even a little early goes a long way toward not standing while you enjoy the show. I'll get there early and try to save as many seats as possible, but some help with that would be appreciated.
results.name: BAMcafe: PUBLIQuartet

results.description:
‘TONY BENNETT & BILL EVANS – THE LEGENDARY RECORDINGS” will be performed by the Joel Zelnik Trio with Grammy nominee vocalist Annette Sanders on Friday, March 11, 2016. Sets at 8:00 &10 pm. They will perform at
Trumpets Jazz Club & Restaurant, 6 Depot Square, Montclair, NJ 07042 www.trumpetsjazz.com[masked] for tickets and reservations
COST: See Groupon coupon available at https://www.groupon.com/deals/trumpets-jazz-club

This timely program is based on the dialogues between Closter NJ residents Joel Zelnik and Bill Evans, a 7 time Grammy Award Winner, at the “Village Gate”in NYC, during the mid-1960’s. Signature Evans works are performed and Joel plays pieces he enjoys that show the Evans influence. Highlighted is the collaboration of Bill Evans & Tony Bennett during 1975 and ‘77, which yielded some of the best recordings in the history of jazz.

Few listeners realized that Tony Bennett was as much of a jazz singer as almost anybody; he had already made a handful of albums in a small jazz combo format, but these were far lesser known than his big chart hits. Then, in 1975, he made what would be his supreme statement in the jazz field, the first of two albums with the remarkable pianist Bill Evans.

Joel had the great fortune of playing at the Top of the Gate in NYC during the mid 60’s, on Monday nights. It was on these Mondays that he split sets with the Bill Evans Trio, and his greatness has stayed with Joel right up to the present. They reprise this remarkable collaboration of American Art Song at its finest, by recapturing the virility and expressiveness in these performances. It is a beautiful surprising repertoire – no Gershwin, no Ellington, no blues. They’re mostly songs associated with great female singers: Mabel Mercer and Billie Holiday, as well as Bill Evans’ own “Waltz For Debby” with Gene Lees’ lyrics.
Annette is a Grammy nominee with 5 CDs, has sung with Benny Goodman, Mel Torme, Antonio Carlos Jobim. She was the featured vocalist in Dick Hyman’s Jazz Series at the 92nd St. Y, and also performed in The Billy Taylor Jazz Series at Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C. Her distinctive recognizable sound has been heard on thousands of jingles, movie sound tracks, and CD’s.
Please visit website for video, bio, music, press and more: www.joelzelnik.com
results.name: Hear The Joel Zelnik Trio with Annette Sanders

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
Every other week, we meet up in Elmsford for karaoke. Since the music starts at 10:00, some of us also meet up at 8:30 for dinner beforehand, while others come only for the dinner and drinks. Come join us for some alcohol, bar food, and good times!

There is free valet parking, and when the valet guy leaves, he parks your car very close by (as parking becomes more available) and gives you back your keys. Street parking is also readily available.

If you're interested in both eating and singing, don't forget to sign up for the karaoke event too!

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

venue.name: Jalopy Theatre and School of Music

results.description:
SQUARE & BIG CIRCLE SQUARE DANCES
LIVE CALLER & LIVE BAND

Dave Harvey, caller
with
Nick Stillman, fiddle; Eli Hetko, Banjo; Indiana Hoover, guitar

You'll dance squares from the southern mountains to red-hot, lightning-fast fiddle tunes.  Come join the party as you "roll the barrel", "rip 'n' snort" and "ride the waves" all night long.  This is a public event, so Meetup members join the larger throng.  We average 75 dancers at each event.  

The Fabulous Jalopy Theater has become the center for traditional music and dance in the city, and those loyal to our event and to the space return time after time to join us for dancing.  However, all dances are taught just before you dance them, so no experience is necessary.  The crowd is exceptionally friendly and ready to welcome any newcomers, so there's no need to bring a partner - anyone and everyone can find one there.  Jalopy is a music venue, so they have a full bar, and next door the Jalopy Tavern offers a full menu for those who want to show up early for dinner, and you can grab at drink with us if you hang around after.

Instruction for the dance isn't necessary, but if you are a beginner, want to refine your step, or want to add some flair to your dancing, show up early - at 8:30 - and learn all you'll need to know...and then some.  But this isn't a dance class, it's a DANCE PARTY!  You can show up at any time and join in.

8:30 - 9:00 PM:             INSTRUCTION
9:00 PM - Midnight:    SQUARE DANCE

More info on the following websites: NYCBarnDance.com and Jalopy.biz

$15 door / $13 advance (+$2 service fee)

We have sold out shows on many occasions, so purchase  
ADVANCE TICKETS!  They will be available soon at Jalopy.biz.


JALOPY in RED HOOK 
315 Columbia St. 
Btwn. Hamilton & Woodhull 
G/F to Carroll St. 
Walk west to Columbia St.
results.name: NYC Barn Dance - Friday, March 11

results.description:
If you're looking for  Friday night fun this is it! You won't want to miss this coverband. I recently recommended them to a Meetup member and she was on the fence about going. She decided to go and said it was one of her most fun and best nights out ever!

"The Wisenheimers" are a New Jersey party & wedding band performing an infectious set of rock, pop & top-40 hits. 

Much more than just a cover band, this professional party band features both male and female lead vocals, great harmonies, and an amazing instrumental section. With over 14 years of experience performing together, there's nothing this band can't cover. From the 60's through today,  They play it all! 

Based out of Northern New Jersey, the Wisenheimers perform all over the tri-state area. 

http://www.thewisenheimers.com/


See you Soon! 

Tracey

venue.address_1: Tito Puente Education Complex 240 East 109th Street. Entrance right off 2nd Ave
venue.name: Tito Puente Education Complex

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

venue.name: La Fama - Salsa Social

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet at La Fama; New York City's all new Salsa Dance Party in the heart of Manhattan's Time Square. 


We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in. Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 3:00am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday.

results.description:
You just got a bill from your Dr that isn't covered by insurance, Con-Ed somehow didn't get your payment last month, Bank of America is tacking on transaction fees when no transactions were made. Don't just sit there and take it.. There are 6 words that get results!

LET ME SPEAK TO YOUR MANAGER!!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room.

Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating in the backroom starts at 9:30 and the show starts shortly after. 
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum.

Come out and celebrate the weekend with some laughs!

results.description:
In the generic Canadian suburb of Bailey Downs live Ginger (Katharine Isabelle) and Brigitte (Emily Perkins), 15-year-old sisters committed to introversion, menstruation anxiety, and terminal misanthropy. Three years late for their first period, they spend their time staging gruesome death scenes for their own amusement, amidst the willful ignorance of their relentlessly perky mother (Mimi Rogers). On the night Ginger finally gets her period, the sisters are attacked in the woods by a ferocious creature that may have some connection to "The Beast of Bailey Downs," a predator currently disemboweling its way through the local dog population. The girls survive the attack, and Ginger's wounds heal quickly, but her attitude grows even more bizarre, as hair sprouts from her scars and a tail grows from her spine. Adding to the terror, she starts dating boys. A panicked Brigitte forces herself to befriend Sam (Kris Lemche), the high school pot supplier, whose brand of ganja may be the only cure for Ginger's troubling ailment.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zoa1A987A_k

results.description:
You are invited to join us again for another smooth evening of Jazz at the historic Blue Note Jazz Club, in downtown Manhattan!

Our NYBL Meetup Group with get together to enjoy a Jazz set at the Blue Note by musician Maurico de Souza!

Born in Brasília, Brazil, Maurício de Souza is a jazz drummer who easily performs in both traditional jazz and Brazilian jazz styles. His good taste and finesse have allowed him to play in numerous settings with various accomplished musicians. De Souza was a pupil of Joe Morello and is also influenced by Buddy Rich, Airto Moreira, Dave Weckl, Roy Haynes, and Bill Stewart. 

The showtime is at 12:30am, but we strongly encourage members to meet in front of the venue by 11:45pm, so that we can meet and greet and be seated together to enjoy this great performance! NOTE: THIS WILL BE VIDEO TAPED LIVE. Dress to impress, "Family".


Below is a clip from a recent performance at The Blue Note:

https://youtu.be/bbZUchaj10M

Our Event Host, Sheila (SheBella) will be your hostess for the evening.

You may purchase your ticket(s) ($10 in advance, $15 at the door) directly from the venue via the link below:

Blue Note Advanced Ticket Link 


We hope to see you there!

results.description:
"Could have, Should have, Would have" BS is not how we do @BpLoveOutdoors. Last chance to ski this season, so Come through! The last trip was a blast!


As the Great Northern Catskills' premier winter destination, Hunter Mountain maintains renowned terrain, award-winning learning facilities and luxury mountainside accommodations.  With high-efficiency snowmaking on 100% of its trails, an entire dedicated learning area perfect for beginners and families alike, the expert terrain of Hunter West and Empire Terrain park, Hunter has something for everyone.  Hunter Mountain, has got skiers and snowboarders covered! Trail Map Link

Peep our very own model and member Sharifa below :-) 

Purchase Tickets Here: BpLoveOutdoors Mar 12th Hunter Tickets


RSVP is not confirmed until payment is received. Best pay early!

Ski/ Snowboard Packages:
1. Bus & All Mtn Lift ($99.00)
2. Bus, All Mtn Lift, & Rental ($134.00)
3. Bus, All Mtn Lift, (Rental & Lesson) ($169.00)
4. Bus,Beginner area (lower mountain lifts), Lesson & Rental Package ($139.00)
**Recommended for newbies!
5. Bus & Equipt Rental ($94.00)
6. Bus Only ($49.00)  
7. Not listed. If you want to drive yourself which I personally don't recommend because you miss the bonding time, sleep/rest and laughs... you'll need to get your ticket from the mountain.

Trip Details: Please arrive 30 minutes early for bus.
Mountain departure time: 4:30PM
Transportation: Coach bus (Relax there & back)
Amenities: Reclining chairs, Bathroom, movies & some drinks.


Pickup Location and times:
1. (6:30 AM) Downtown Brooklyn/Barclay vicinity
Atlantic Ave. & 3rd Avenue
514 Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn New, York 11217 (map)
* In front of Rent Ride Return store *

2. (6:45 AM) Union Square - Manhattan
14th Street & 3rd Avenue
129 3rd Avenue, New York, New York 10003 (map)
* In front of Duane Reade *

3. (7:00 AM) Upper West Side - Manhattan
Amsterdam Ave. and 72 St.
2086 Broadway, New York, NY 10023 (map)
* In front of The Vitamin Shoppe *

Notes:
1. When you board the bus come to the back! More than likely we will all be on the same bus. The bus is not a charter but we will try to keep our group to the back of the bus.
2. This trip is at cost to everyone so I'm not acting as a babysitter...Just putting it out there, God knows I don tried. (Read the info, do a little bit of research, and come with a positive attitude).
3. While we don't anticipate any issues, note that you are participating in this activity at your own risk and liability.

Common Questions/ Complaints

1. I'll be cold - No you'll more than likely be sweating after you start moving.

2. I can't do it - There's 3 years olds & Grannies on the mountain. Signup for a lesson!

3. Black Ppl don't ski - Well maybe you should stay home then.

4. I have work Monday - The bus returns very early to NY, You'll have too much time on your hands! 

5. I don't know anyone, don't wanna come alone or I'll get kidnapped - Really?! A. No one want's to kidnap your ass B. Most ppl come alone..that's the point. This group is about breaking outside your comfort zone & being great :-)

Come Through Fam!! Let's Live a little

Possible Dinner or Drinks if we're up to it later.

Important Tips:
1. Start working on your squats/ Legs. 
2. Wear Proper ski pants. And a proper jacket (Marshalls, Models, REI)
3. Purchase Ski goggles ~$20 @ a Sports store (More $ @ the mountain).
4. Wear Thermals under your ski pants and coat.
5. Wear proper weatherproof gloves!!
6. A long hat or face mask is recommended.
7. Thick Socks
8. I will have some hand and leg warmers for sale on the bus. ($3 for the set/$1.50ea)

9. Bring Snacks banana etc - food is a bit pricey at the mountain.

10. There are storage lockers at the mountain for a small fee or you can leave things on the bus and get it at the end of the day.

www.facebook.com/BpLoveOutdoors (Chat with us on fb)

Refunds:
Cancellations must be made at least 72 hours before your trip departure time in order to receive a full refund. Cancellations made up to 48 hours before your trip departure time will receive a 50% refund. Cancellations made within 48 hours or your trip departure time will receive no refund. No refunds will be issued for missed buses. See nycsnowbus/ terms for more info.
results.name: Let's Ski & Snowboard Day Trip (Hunter, Mar12th)

results.description:
It looks like we are going to have good weather on Saturday so it's time to get back outdoors!

I know the start time is early so if you can't make it at that time, don't worry. Just post your estimated arrival time in the comments (even if you think you'll make it at 9am) I can stick around until 10am but I have to leave around that time. 

One more thing: I didn't cap the RSVP. But there are only 5 courts available. I don't intend to tie up all the courts. I will add an RSVP cap once I see who will be showing up at what time. Keeping it loose.... as usual.

Can't wait! :)


---- FAQ ----


What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
results.name: Saturday Morning Outdoor Tennis @ Haffen Park

results.description:
***UPDATE - Worried you don't have the right setup to participate?  718 Cyclery has been kind enough to offer 10% off gear (not bikes) for participants of this ride/event.  Update your kit!***

Mark your calendars for the first official NYC Adventure Cycling Club group ride. 

Who: NYC Adventure Cycling Club members 

What: Overnight ride from Brooklyn to Harriman State Park 

When: Saturday, March 12th - Sunday, March 13th 

Where: 718 Cyclery (254 3rd Ave Brooklyn) 

Why: Porque no? 

Assuming global warming does its job and keeps temps agreeable, join organizers David and Chris as they ride an 'overnighter' from Brooklyn to Harriman State Park and back. Any and all welcome. Will be a leisurely paced ride on majority sealed tarmac. ~55 miles each day. Rough agenda below...

Saturday: 

7:30am:  Meet at 718 for coffee and check tire pressures 

8:00am-4:00pm:  Riding w/ a couple of planned pit stops 

4:00pm:  Set up camp near Sebago Lake

Sunday: 

8:00am:  Break down camp 

9:00am-5:00pm:  Riding (can shave off considerable time by hopping subway just after GW Bridge crossing) 

5:00pm:  Finish ride at 718 

Minimum you'll need...
+ Bike (organizers are on road touring options)
+ Flat repair kit (tubes, patches, tools, pump, etc)
+ Sleeping option (tent, hammock, bivy, etc)
+ Appropriate clothing (may get cold)
+ Water/snacks
+ Small amount of $ for food/drinks along the route

***Disclaimer - Upon RSVP of this Meetup, you agree to “bear all risks” and release the organizers and event hosts from claims, demands, and damages arising out of your use of the platform. Group organizers are not guides. Bicycling on public roads contains risk. Attendees understand and intend that this assumption of risk and release is binding upon their heirs, executors, and guests who are not active members of the New York Adventure Cycling Club Meetup group. Long story short, if you choose to join for rides, organizers are not responsible for participants health, safety, and/or well being.
results.name: Group Overnight Ride /// Harriman State Park

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Trip Details: http://www.ramblr.com/web/mymap/trip/47098/233097/

Inspired by the stories of the thru-hikers and my recent reading of "A Walk in the Woods: Rediscovering America on the Appalachian Trail" by Bill Bryson, yet I cannot afford to quit my job to do the full trail --neither would I dare to hike thousands of miles in one trip to be honest-- I decided to lead a section AT hike over two days. The first leg is from Mount Peter in Warwick to Arden (roughly 11 miles) and is scheduled on 3/12 (Sat). The second leg is from Arden to Jones Point (roughly 18 miles) and is scheduled on 4/9 (Sat). This hike is not designed for the beginners who have never navigated themselves in the woods using maps and a compass or GPS. All the participants are expected to be independent and self-sufficient, as the group will walk at his or her own pace without a sweep. The group will meet at NJ Transit ticket counters at Port Authority Bus Terminal at 08:10 and take NJ Transit Bus #197 departing PABT at 08:30 to Mt. Peter (AMC Transportation Code: 3G). The bus will stop at the junction of 17A and Kain Road ONLY upon your request. It is scheduled for arrival at 09:20. The hike will begin at 09:30. We'll wrap up the 11-mile hike by 14:00, which would return the average pace of 2.44 miles/hour, including breaks, and catch the Coach USA Shortline bus from Arden (AMC Transportation Code: 1F) at 14:18 back to PABT at 15:33. More details here: http://activities.outdoors.org/search/index.cfm/action/details/id/88464
results.name: Section AT (Leg-1 of 2): Mt. Peter to Arden

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
Our Bear Mountain trail runs are back!


This event is FOR RUNNERS. If you can currently run a flat half-marathon under 2.5 hours, then you'll be fine on this run. Hikers, no worries, we'll soon post events for you as well.


COURSE: We'll go up and then run down the Bear Mountain at least once (more if the group is fast). Terrain there is challenging (rocks, roots, mud, etc), be prepared. Combined elevation gain - over 1200ft per loop (around 6 miles).


Here is a map of all trails in the area, have it with you just in case: http://nysparks.com/parks/attachments/BearMountainTrailMap.pdf


NYC PICK UP: To reserve a ride just RSVP to this meetup. The location of pick up is next to the bus station by GW Bridge (please get there by 8 am sharp!). To get there you can take A train (to 175th street). We will be waiting in our huge black RawMobile at the corner of 178th street and Fort Washington Avenue (next to the fruit stand). My phone number is 929-99O-7784 just in case.


The drive takes less than one hour, we'll be back in NYC around 1-2pm.


The price to RSVP will go up as more people sign up (to reward those who register early).

We will get to the Bear Mountain by 8:50am and will spend at least 2-3 hours there. Faster runners can carry extra water in the backpack to get more exercise, we'll try to stick all together.


If you don't need a ride from NYC, then just come over to the Bear Mountain and meet us there (see the map at the bottom of this post). In that case there is no need to RSVP here or pay, but please let me know that you're coming (send me a meetup message). If you're coming on your own, then remember to bring some cash as they might be already charging for parking at Bear Mountain.


Cell reception: T-mobile doesn't work well there, AT&T is a bit better. Please ask questions in advance and try to be on time.

Bathrooms: There are nice bathrooms right by our starting point on the parking lot.

Attire: I would recommend trail running shoes. Bring wind-proof jacket, it’s a bit colder there than in the NYC area. Also, be ready for some mud. Feel free to bring a set of dry clothes to change (in the bathroom) after the hike. You can leave extra stuff in the car while we run.


Water/Food: We will have complementary bottles of water and some fruit for everyone. Feel free to bring your own snacks/drinks as well.


Weather: Seems great so far.


Any questions - send me a meetup message. Just in case, my cell is[masked]O-7784.

Legal Disclaimer
results.how_to_find_us: Bear Mountain, parking lot by the Skating Rink (see map below)
results.name: Bear Mountain Trail Run! NYC Pickup/Drop-off (optional)

Visitors to the PHS Philadelphia Flower Show are treated to fabulous design, live entertainment, gardening how-to workshops, and lectures by experts.

results.description:
Commit to a healthier mind, body and spirit.  Join me as we reconnect with our mind and body. You will be lead through a guided meditation to prepare you for   our asana (poses) practice geared for beginners and more! 


You can choose to pay $15 for a drop in class or take advantage of our 'class pass.' 3 classes for $40 or 5 classes for $60.

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: 

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
About 23 miles and 9 hours, fast-paced hike across the George Washington Bridge then north along the Palisades on the Batt to Bear Trail and the Old Erie Trail to Nyack. Return to NYC by bus.

This hike has beautiful views along the Hudson River; it also has a steep descent and a steep ascent; trails with rocks, tree roots, branches and fallen trees that must be walked, climbed or clambered over and very few drop off points. There will be limited restrooms on the first part of the hike, as most of the park facilities are locked for the winter.

The route: The Batt to Bear Trail is mapped out over a number of existing trails leading from The Battery in Manhattan to Bear Mountain. We will follow it to Nyack.

After crossing the George Washington Bridge to New Jersey, we'll follow the Long Path north to the Carpenter's Trail, descend a steep rock staircase to the shore, walk north to the Ross Dock Picnic area, then take the Shore Trail north, stop at the Englewood Picnic Area to eat then continue to the Closter Dock trail, which we will follow back up to the top of the Palisades and rejoin the Long Path.

Next, we will take a rest stop at the Palisades Park HQ, then continue along the Long Path to our second lunch break at the State Line Lookout, which has a small cafe. We continue on a short portion of the Long Path past the Lamont Doherty Observatory, take a quick rest stop at a roadside cafe, then enter Tallman Park. At the north end of Tallman Park we enter the village of Piermont and reach the Old Erie Path, which we follow into Nyack, ending at South Broadway and Church Street in front of the Brickhouse bar to catch the bus.

Dropout Points: The first dropout point we reach will be at Closter Dock Road about 9 miles into the hike, then there will be more dropout points as we continue north. All of the dropout points require standing by the side of the road waiting for the bus.

Here is the route map: GWB to Nyack

Here is the trail map for Palisades Park, which has most of the hike in great detail including where to catch the bus if you drop out: Palisades Park trails

The return: We should reach Nyack before 6:00 p.m. There is a 5:38 bus that does not stop at the George Washington Bridge Bus Station and arrives at the Port Authority Bus Terminal at 6:50. There is a 6:38 bus that reaches the George Washington Bridge Bus Station at 7:27 and the Port Authority Bus Terminal at 7:52. Fare is $9.75 to the GWB or $11.10 to the Port Authority. Pay the fare in cash on the bus; best to have the exact amount.

Here is the Rockland Coach schedule: Rockland Coach

Another option is to take the Tappan Zee Express from Nyack to either the Tarrytown or White Plains train station, $2.00 fare. There are buses at 5:25 and 6:20. If you want Tarrytown, confirm with the bus driver that the bus is making that stop, sometimes they go straight to White Plains.

Here is the Tappan Zee Express schedule: Tappan Zee Express

Meet: at the George Washington Bridge Bus Station temporary waiting room, at Fort Washington Avenue and 179th Street. Take the A train to 175th Street.

Bring lunch, snacks, water; it will be about 5 hours before we reach any food for sale. We will take short lunch breaks at the Englewood Picnic Area and again at State Line Lookout.

Leader: Tom Bergen[masked] [masked]

Contact hike leader directly if you have questions about the hike.

Free for paid annual Shorewalkers members, $3 for non-members, visit www.shorewalkers.org to join.
results.name: GWB to Nyack via the Batt to Bear Trail

Приглашаем посетить еще одну вершину Catskills Panther Mountain 3720'

Маршрут для нас новый.

Ходим медленно:-)

-----

Panther Mountain 3720'

Start point GPS: N[masked] W[masked]

[masked],[masked]

End Point: N[masked] W[masked]

[masked], [masked]

Map: Catskills Trails/ Central Catskills #42

We are going to meet at the end point:

[masked], [masked]


http://www.topozone.com/map/?lat=42.05639&lon=-74.395

This is not a round trip. We need at least 2 cars.

Total Climb 2850 ft.

Total distance: 7.5 miles

Difficulty: moderate.

At the top there is a fine view to the east.

The trail ascends gradually with a few rock scrambles until the 3500' sign

There are several false peaks before the 3500' sign

From the 3500' sign up there are several rock scrambles.

Panther Mountain is one of the Catskills High Peaks, located in the Town of Shandaken in Ulster County, New York. At approximately 3,720 feet (1,130 m) in elevation, it is the 18th highest in the range. A combination of factors has led geologists to believe the mountain is on the site of an ancient meteorite impact crater.

Panther is one of the required winter peaks for the Catskills 3500 Club.

You need:

- Hiking Boots

- Micksospikes

- Water

--------------------------------

that may happen at a planned event. It is your responsibility to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on this trip signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

results.description:
Hi everyone, 

Thank you to all who made it out to our CS Ed Opportunities event on Wednesday!

I'm pleased to announce the March edition of the CS Pedagogy Meetup. As always, our presenters will share valuable tools and strategies for teaching CS. See below for details.

Presentations will begin promptly at 9:45am, so PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME and remember to bring a photo ID for entry to the building. Bring a laptop as well, if possible.

If you're interested in speaking at one of our future Pedagogy Meetups, please fill out this presenter form.

> Sara Vogel, Francisco Cervantes & Joliz Cedeño - Translanguaging and Computer Science

Recognizing the language diversity within NYC CS classrooms, this presentation will prompt participants to reflect on connections between the latest theories of bilingual education and computer science. Participants will also pick up some "translanguaging" strategies that CS educators can use to help young bilingual students acquire skills in CS and to empower them to develop positive multilingual language identities. Those who bring a lesson plan will have the opportunity to revise it to include a translanguaging strategy.


Sara is a PhD Student in Urban Education, CUNY-Graduate Center & Research Assistant, CUNY-NYS Initiative on Emergent Bilinguals.

Francisco is Digital Learning Manager, ExpandED Schools.


Joliz is Program Manager at ScriptEd.


> Ben Samuels-Kalow - Juggling with One Hand: Small Group Instruction and Differentiation in the CS Classroom

This session will show different ideas around groupings and learning experiences for students, both for building independence and for direct instruction and questioning in targeted groups. Ben will demonstrate strategies (and student work) produced from small groups in HTML/CSS/JS, Python, and SNAP. These strategies can be applied to other languages. If you want to maximize hands on time for students and instruct as efficiently as possible, please come and discuss. 


Ben is a CS teacher at The Laboratory School of Finance & Technology. 

> Rosanna Sobota - Teaching Functions Using the Design Recipe

Bootstrap is a program that combines programming and algebra, providing curricula and training for math and computer science teachers. At the end of a Bootstrap class, students have a completed programming problems, math challenges, and a videogame of their own design. This presentation will cover the basics of Racket, a functional programming language. Rosanna will discuss how math concepts can be reinforced in a computer science class and how math classes can benefit from a programming component. A key element of Bootstrap is the Design Recipe, a concrete problem-solving scheme that aids students in writing functions. In this presentation, participants will take an in-depth look at the Design Recipe, practice programming functions using this tool, and discuss its value to both students and educators.

Rosanna is Regional Manager at Bootstrap.

> Eric Allatta - Programming Music with EarSketch

In this presentation, Eric will provide an overview of the EarSketch programming tool and curriculum. He will share a hands-on approach to pedagogy and programming through EarSketch. EarSketch is the quintessential engaging curriculum through which the quietest students can become stars and the relevance of computer science becomes immediately clear. 

Eric is a CS teacher at the Academy for Software Engineering (AFSE).
results.name: CS Pedagogy Meetup - March 2016 Edition

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Here is a typical agenda of Art of Speaking Toastmasters Club's meeting.


• The Sgt at Arms calls for meeting to begin

• President of the club welcomes members and guests.  Invites the Toastmaster of the day to facilitate the meeting

• Toastmaster of the Day (TMOD) introduces other duty holders.


• TMOD invites speakers who have scheduled to speak that day. Members take turns to complete their projects under the Competent Communication manual or from one of the advanced manuals. Members & Guests offer feedback to the speakers. They also fill out ballots to select best speaker.


• After the prepared speeches segment is complete, Impromptu speeches (Table Topics) segment begins. All Guests are invited to participate. The goal is to think on your feet and speak for 1 to 2 minutes. Guests & Members fill out ballots to select best Table Topics contestant.


• Short Break to enable socializing & networking.


• Meeting reconvenes. General Evaluator takes charge of the meeting. Invites Evaluators to present their feedback on the prepared speeches. Guests & Members fill out ballots to select best evaluator.


• General Evaluators returns the control of the meeting back to the President of the club.


• President gives away awards to the best speaker, best Table Topics contestant and best Evaluator.


• Meeting comes to an end approximately between 12.15 pm and 12.30 pm.

16th Anniversary New York City FIRST® Competition & Expo

Should be a super fun day lined up with fun and interesting events!  And of course since this is a Will Fong event there will be good eats for lunch?

***Meeting 10am just inside the Jacob Javits Center glass door entrances on 11th Ave closer to south side of building.***

New York City FIRST® (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology) along with over 200 robotics teams from the New York tri-state area, Brazil, China, Ecuador, Turkey, the Netherlands, and the United Kingdom will compete, with winning teams advancing to the global competition.

The FIRST® Expo brings three intense robotics competitions under one roof. Watch as FIRST® Robotics Competition, FIRST® Tech Challenge, and FIRST® LEGO® League student teams compete to win the regional competition and for a chance to go onto the global competition. Also, join us for a career fair, where you will be able to talk to college representatives and fortune companies about careers in technology.


Jacob Javits Convention Center

THIS EVENT IS FREE AND OPEN TO THE PUBLIC

80 middle school teams of technological innovators, exploring the cutting-edge world of Biomedical Engineering selected from among 190 teams across the City at borough qualifying tournaments.

Will

results.description:
There are a variety of New York-area museums participating in the Smithsonian-sponsored annual Museum Day Live event, a nationwide program that offers free one-day museum admission to several different venues.  Participating museums include: 

 - Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum


 - The Museum of the City of New York

 - and many others, please see list on the link below

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/museumday/venues/museum-day-live-march-2016/

This year's event is Saturday, March 12. Unfortunately I will be out of town during on this date, and will thus be unable to attend.  However, I wanted to post this information anyway because this a great opportunity to visit some great museums, for free.

Perhaps a couple members of the group can "host" this event?  As host you would just figure which museum to go to, where to meet the group (at the main entrance?), answer any questions people may have beforehand, help guide the group through the museum, etc.  Being a host is pretty simple and I can help with any questions you may have.

If no one is able to help lead this event I'll just leave it on the calendar as a "no host" event and you can stop by on your own and tour a museum - for free.

Please note that if you are attending this event I strongly recommend arriving early (when the museum first opens?) to avoid the crowds that are bound to show up for this free event.  Also, if you are attending you need to register beforehand for your free ticket via the Smithsonian web site (so they know how many people will be attending).  Link provided below:  

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/museumday/museum-day-live-march-2016/

Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

Pier 86, West 46th Street & 12th Avenue, New York, NY, 10036

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 103rd Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
This Beginner Productivity Workshop is a primer on personal productivity systems, and a core look at the Getting Things Done (GTD) methodology, taught to you by Ray Sidney-Smith. It's mission is to help those without experience practicing GTD learn the basics and how to apply these stress-free productivity skills, strategies and tactics to command and control the "game of life and business of work," as David Allen says.


You'll learn:

• Why collect everything that has your attention? And, where to put it?

• What do you ask yourself to get to the "do-ability" of a thing, and name it as a project or task?

• What are the Areas of Focus and Responsibility in my life and how do those relate to my productivity system?

• How do you keep your system stress-free, sustainable?

• With your system in place, how do you handle overwhelm, distraction, procrastination and bad habits?

You'll get:

• A Beginner Productivity Workshop GTD workbook.

• Several productivity worksheets and tools I've assembled over the years.

• Access to a 5-part video series on GTD by Ray Sidney-Smith and Augusto Pinaud, covering the GTD Workflow process and Weekly Review.

• A pre-release digital copy of Ray's new book, Keeping Accountable, when it comes out later this year.

Agenda:

10AM-1015AM Registrations & Mix-and-Mingle

1030AM Introductions & Agenda

11AM Part I - Getting Started With GTD

     | Productivity Systems & GTD Method Primer

     | "SWOT" Your Productivity (Exercise)

12PM Part II - Capture & Process

     | Getting Everything In "In" Properly


     | Getting "In" Out & Empty Effectively


1PM Lunch Break

2PM Part III - Organize & Review

     | Organizing Your Life and Work


     | Looking at Your Life and Work When You Need to


245PM Break

3PM Part IV - Executing Effectively

     | Overcoming Overwhelm, Distraction, Procrastination, & Bad Habits


     | Question & Answer


4PM Celebrate Your New GTD White, Yellow, or Green Belts!

Thanks to our host venue, Jazmine.com -- your online personal and family life organizer! Sign up for a 30-day free trial!

Disclaimer: This workshop is not presented in conjunction nor certified/authorized by David Allen Company. It is our group's way of teaching new members who have no experience with Getting Things Done® (GTD®). Both the name "Getting Things Done" and acronym "GTD" are the intellectual properties of David Allen Company.

results.description:
March spring in your step? Bring your own ipod & earbuds--everybody listens to their own music as we dance walk around the park loop. What is "dance walking"? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. Check out this funny and smart article recently published about the Dance Walk in Prospect Park:

http://themomtropolis.com/dance-walk-you-know-you-want-to/

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Lincoln Park in Jersey City, . Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.
results.name: Saturday Tennis at Lincoln Park, Jersey City

Please cross-post:

Here are the details of the anti-Ringling demonstration:

WHERE: Ringling's 3 Ring Circus of Horror and Atrocity

The Prudential Center, 165 Mulberry Street, Newark, NJ, 07102

WHEN: Saturday March 12, 2016

TIME: 10:00am - 11:30am
Point Person: Richard - cell #[masked]-5302...
ASSEMBLY POINT: The corner of Lafayette & Mulberry Streets in the Ironbound Section of Newark, right outside the Prudential Center (see below map:)
MAP: http://www.mapquest.com/?version=1.0&hk=8-88kqUwFN

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: from NYC -Penn Station in NYC, one train to Penn Station in Newark. Go outside and you will see the large Prudential Center sign on top of the building approx 1 block away.

DETAILS ON PARKING: There is parking on sidestreets everywhere in the vicinity of Mulberry & Lafayette Streets, and a number of municipal lots in the local area as well. Please think ahead and bring some quarters for metered parking, if you aren't lucky enough to find free parking (which is ample!)


There will also be protests at Ringling's following performances:

Saturday March 12, 6:00 - 8:00 pm

Sunday, March 13, 10:00 - 11:30 am

Sunday March 13, 2:00 - 4:00 pm

Sunday March 13, 6:00 - 8:00 pm

Please help FAUN and our friends/allies stand up for animals enslaved by the heartless, horrific enterprise known as Ringling Bros Circus. Animals are enslaved, abused and forced to spend their dismal, horrendous lives engaging in behaviors wholly unnatural to them, performing under constant threat of pain and punishment by this ravenous cash machine of a "circus". and get treated like garbage even as those who survive all the horror, a joyless life of mechanistic use and abuse, approach convalescence.

Again, we will have signs, leaflets and relevant props. If you have something you want to bring, that's fine, but all you NEED to bring is YOURSELF, a heart full of empathy/compassion and a voice to demonstrate your love for pachyderms,primates, bears, big cats, all creatures great and small.

blessed be ALL animals, FIGHT for their rights!!

Meetup/Hangout – 9:45 am

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

Whole Foods has ALL THE FOOD. Come get some.

What to expect: a seriously fun group of runners who definitely do not take running too seriously . We will meet, chat, RUN, stretch, chat, EAT BREAKFAST and then leave. It’s that easy. First we run, then we eat!

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>
results.name: Tennis Social (60 degrees)

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015


WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 


[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Hopefully the weather conditions will allow us to go hiking through  the park again.

We will hike parts of all the trails along with some unmarked trails this week.

Meet time is 10:30 AM and we start to walk at 10:45 SHARP! 

Legends from the park attribute an increase in fertility, when the frogs head is touched. We don't know if this is true or not. But...

There will be slippery leaves, mud, rocks, roots, and logs or fallen trees across the paths. Some of the trails are unmarked and have rough surfaces. Because of this we suggest you wear boots or high shoes that will grip the path surfaces.

The hike should last about one and one half hours + or - a few minutes. 

Length is about 3 to 4 miles again + or - a bit.

A voluntary donation of $1.00 is requested to cover the cost of the Meetup web site.

CYA there!
