results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Special Event: Tara Puja

The Tara Puja, Liberation from Sorrow, which includes a special prayer, Praises to the Twenty-one Taras, composed by Buddha, is performed regularly at Kadampa Buddhist centers worldwide.  Tara is a female Buddha, a manifestation of the ultimate wisdom of all the Buddhas.  Temporarily Tara saves us from the dangers of rebirth in the three lower realms, and ultimately she saves us from the dangers of samsara and solitary peace.<a href="http://meditatenj.org/newsite/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/Tara.gif"></a>

If we rely upon Mother Tara sincerely and with strong faith she will protect us from all obstacles and fulfill all our wishes. Since she is a wisdom Buddha, and since she is a manifestation of the completely purified wind element, Tara is able to help us very quickly.

As a community we will recite the twenty-one verses of praise receiving inconceivable benefits. These praises are very powerful because they are Sutra, the actual words of Buddha. It is good to recite them as often as we can.

Everyone Welcome.  No previous meditation experience necessary. You may bring an offering of (vegetarian) food or (non-alcoholic) drink if you wish.

Free Special Event!
results.how_to_find_us: Meditatenj.org
results.name: Special Event: Tara Puja

results.description:
Beginner Bhangra sessions are for you

- if you want to learn how to groove at a club/party

- if you are all for letting loose at a wedding

- if you are Indian and still can't do the "Chaffa" (don't worry, we'll show you how;)

- if you are not Indian and want to join the latest dance trend

- if you want to have a blast while learning an awesome dance skill

results.description:
FOUNDATIONS OF MINDFULNESS - THE MIND

The mind in its natural state can be compared to the sky, covered by layers of cloud which hide its true nature.

– Kalu Rinpoche

We have been looking at the foundational elements of mindfulness. We've explored the breath, the body, our emotions and our thoughts and thinking. These different objects of meditation give us the sensory entry points we can use to find a deeper understanding of the mind.

This week we'll move on and take a mindful look at the mind and mind states. We consider these each time we look at what mind state or mood we bring to the meditation cushion. And, of course, our state of mind has a great deal of influence over how we approach life both on and off of the cushion.

Traditionally, the teachings around mind begin with the examination of three root mind states that interfere with being fully aware and "clearly knowing." Is our mind state rooted in greed or desire; is our mind state rooted in hatred or anger; or, is our mind state rooted in delusion or ignorance or confusion?

The teachings let us know the importance of learning both when the three mind states are present and when they aren't. If greed or desire is not present, do we know generosity; if anger is not present, do we know kindness; and, if delusion is not present, do we know wisdom?

Clear knowing of both aspects of these root states is how we tell the difference between skillful and unskillful actions in our lives.  It deepens our understanding of what leads to happiness and freedom and what leads to suffering and dissatisfaction.

Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.

I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.

Foundations of Mindfulness - Introduction Mindfulness is more than just paying attention. It is powered by intention, but we also have to get out of our own way to experience clearly what’s actually appearing. We have to find an openness of heart and mind and suspend our judgements and theories and rationales so we can see more than what we always see. We have to begin to relinquish the "I" and "mine" kinds of ownership over what arises in our experience. We also have to unhook from the time line that may bind us to the past or project us to the future and be mindful now.

Over the next few weeks we will explore of the traditional Foundations of Mindfulness.

Introduction to Mindfulness
Mindfulness of the Breath
Mindfulness of the Body
Mindfulness of Emotions
Mindfulness of Thinking
Mindfulness of the Mind
Mindfulness in Daily Life
results.name: Foundations of Mindfulness - The Mind

Calling all poets! Jersey City is now offering a weekly poetry workshop. 

This workshop will start by critiquing 3-4 poems, one by each person signed up ahead of time. The workshop will end, if time permits, with one 10 minute writing prompt (an idea to incorporate into a poem written on the spot).  Poets who sign up to be workshopped must bring printed copies of their poems for the group (recommended: 10 copies). To sign up for a workshop in advance, please contact Sarah Jewell at [masked]. 

While workshopping poems, we will “mind our P’s and Q’s” by Praising first what works in a poem, and then Questioning what might be improved. This helps to keep the feedback positive and constructive. If you are new to critiquing poetry, please see these guidelines:
http://triadwriters.org/inspiration/guidelines-critique-of-poem/

We'll go through Linden Terrace (the highest point in Fort Tryon Park and the second highest natural elevation in Manhattan, with great views of the Hudson and the city). results.description:
Image by Robert Mapplethorpe

Image by Irving Penn

"Foto Walk" - Saturday, 12 March 2k16 at 11:00 AM

The NY Botanical Garden located at 2900 Southern Blvd, Bronx, NY is an Eden of Beauty nestled in the Bronx. This year they celebrate their 14th Annual Orchid Show, entitled "Orchidelirium".  

The SONO Photography Club is happy to partner with "The XposureArtisan Alliance" and share this  great opportunity to discover the world of Macro Fotography and beautiful orchids that will certainly amaze you.

A Macro Lens is not necessary, but a nice option to have. I'm happy to pass around my lens for most Canon users if they want to give it a try. Many lenses do let you shoot up close, so you may want to check your lens specs.

• Admission is $20 for the Conservatory and Grounds
• Parking is $15 per car; So car-pooling is a good option to save money

For more information on the NYBG Orchid Show, please visit: http://www.nybg.org/exhibitions/2016/orchid-show/index.php

For more information on the XposureArtisan Alliance and learn about foto challenges and events, please visit and join us at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/XposureArtisanAlliance/

Stay focused and be well always, 

The SONO Photo Club - The Co-conspirators of Bennett, Fernando & Hillie 

The XposureArtisan Alliance - The Inspiration Team - Hillie + Amanda
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the Cafe, which is just a few yards past the front entrance. Once we are all together, we take a short walk to the Haupt Conservatory.
results.name: NY Botanical Garden - 2k16 "Orchidelirium" - Macro Madness!

results.description:
This is an open house and introduction to Lyndhurst Meditation. This introduction gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth.

At Lyndhurst Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection.

Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom!

If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only! 

We are located at 306 Ridge Rd, Lyndhurst, NJ 07071. Our meditation center is located across the stress from Wendy's. You can park in the front and additional free parking is located in the rear of the building. This introduction will last about an hour to an hour and a half. If you have many plans for the day please say this before the meetup starts so we can accommodate you properly. 

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Lyndhurst Meditation you can call our center to have a personal introduction today! Lyndhurst Meditation is a non-profit organization and is tax deductible. A $10 donation is appreciated for the introduction.
results.name: Lyndhurst Meditation Introduction

results.description:
RSVP'S BEGIN TUESDAY 2/16 AT 9:00PM.  TOUR IS FREE WITH SUGGESTED DONATION OF $1-$2 DOLLARS.

Note - lots of walking on this one - a good 4 miles so I suggest bringing snacks and water.  Optional eating out afterwards in the Lower East Side or Chinatown.

Join us in a unique celebration of Women's History Month with a tour to visit some very special locations in Manhattan associated with individual women and social movements that have had a lasting impact on New York City, the U.S. and the world! 

Neighborhoods: Financial District, Civic Center, Chinatown, Lower East Side.


Meeting at the corner of Wall and Broad Streets by the steps of Federal Hall.Lower Manhattan is where New York City's history begins in the early 17th century, and as we trace the City's dynamic development, we can honor the suffragettes, political activists and leaders who made their mark and who based themselves downtown: Susan B. Anthony and Elizabeth Cady Stanton (their newspaper, The Revolution in 1868); and Victoria Woodhull and Tennessee Claflin (first women stockbrokers), among other women of Wall Street. We'll remember Emily Roebling (who led the completion of the Brooklyn Bridge in the 1870's and 1880's and the women who have shaken up the male establishment at City Hall and the NY City Council. We will also stop at sites associated with early civil rights pioneers and the Underground Railroad, and pay homage to some of the women honored with ticker-tape parades for their achievements including Amelia Earhart, Althea Gibson and Gertrude Ederle. For the grand finale, we'll head over to Henry Street on the Lower East Side to share the story of Lillian Wald, who pioneered public health care to the poor and immigrants, founding Visiting Nurse Services and the Henry Street Settlement.
results.name: Special Walking Tour In Celebration of Women's History Month

Come share a lively chatty brunch with us at Le Botaniste,  a brand new vegan, organic and gluten free restaurant.  We expect to stay at brunch until around 1:00 pm.

After brunch, we'll head over to the Asia Society to view their exhibit on Kamakura Realism and Spirituality in the Sculpture of Japan.  


New York Time states, "Spellbinding" and Wall Street Journal calls it, "A Stellar Lineup."

The Kamakura period dated from[masked] experienced much societal upheavals that which brought about cultural richness in their sculptured and many Buddhist art.  There are around 30 artifacts on exhibition.

Cost: Brunch is $$ based on Yelp.  Asia Society is $12 per ticket.

If you cannot join us for brunch, then just meet us at the Asia Society.  Look forward too seeing everyone.

Eddie

results.description:
Our bodies record and hold all of our experiences. Tension, stress, depression, happiness, love, trauma, pain, gratitude all have a vibrational effect on us and sometimes can sit in our bodies causing mental, spiritual and physical imbalance. 

Vibrant Breathing is an amazing modality which allows you to raise your vibrations while clearing all dense energy blocking your chakras. One breath session is equal to multiple sessions of “talk therapy.'

Denise Munoz, MA, LMSW, RYT, is an integrative therapist and co-founder of Earth Wellness Yoga.  In addition to her Masters in Psychology from Columbia University and Masters of Social Work from Hunter College, Denise is certified as a somatic therapist under the Center for Conscious Healing in NYC,  a Reiki Master of the Usui Lineage and a yoga instructor. 

Health and wellness has been a moving force in Denise’s life. Denise has been working in the field of mental health for over 15 years. She is a licensed social worker with a focus on integrative therapies. Her approach is holistic-understanding that to support someone’s overall health and wellness, it is vital to target mind-body-spirit.  Denise operates from the perspective that everyone has a right to a life free of emotional, physical and spiritual pain.

SPECIAL ONE TIME PRICING 
$30 Veterans with a Valid ID, $45 students (College/Graduate - with Valid ID)  and $60 all others. (all forms of payments welcome, there is a small processing fee on use of debit/cc) on day of workshop. 

You may pay ahead through PayPal. Avoid a service fee by selecting 'send money' and send payment to [masked]


If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Irene through meetup message or email: [masked]
results.name: Vibrant Breathing Workshop with Denise Munoz

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

How many times have you walked through Grand Central and actually taken time to really appreciate how beautiful it is? With this Scavenger Hunt you will not only get to appreciate one of  New York's most iconic buildings, but you will get to meet dozens of interesting NYSN members and friends in a fun and casual way. 

Come alone or with a friend and we will team you up with others attending.  Enjoy a cocktail or cup of coffee with the group then we will send you out on your adventure.

Each team will have 75 minutes to complete the scavenger hunt with a list of questions, challenges, and puzzles.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Following the hunt you can stay at St. Pat's for our Sunday Brunch Party.

Cost: $10 (Please bring exact change to the event)

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

What to wear: dress for the weather but 98% of the clues are inside Grand Central

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We will team you up with other fun people.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and  www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

results.description:
IRISH LANGUAGE MASS 

Saturday, March 12, 12:00 p.m.
Celebrated at historic St. Patrick’s Old Cathedral now the Basilica of St. Patrick’s Old Cathedral.
For the Ninth consecutive year, the NY Irish History Roundtable, Glucksman Ireland House NYU, and the Basilica of Saint Patrick’s will celebrate an Irish-language Mass.

Father Andrew O'Connor of St. Mary's Church in Manhattan will be the celebrant. Liturgical music will be performed on the Basilica's historic 1868 Henry Erben Organ by resident organist Jared Lamenzo, and Paddy Connolly will be the Cantor. There will be readings in Gaelic by several guests.

After the Holy Mass, there will be a party held in the St. Patrick's Youth Center with Traditional Irish music performed live. There will be Irish Step Dancing by students of The Niall O'Leary School of Irish Dance, and there will be Irish Soda Bread, food and beverages available.

So, we will enjoy the Mass, followed by ceili (great music), craic (great conversation), dancing, and refreshments. 

Come and join us to celebrate the Feast of Saint Patrick. 

Free-will contributions will be gratefully accepted.

results.description:
I am a therapist, divorce mediator, and adjunct professor at NYU with a specialization in eating disorders. I am interested in helping to facilitate a monthly meet-up group to discuss experiences, treatment options, and helpful ideas in dealing with eating disorders of all types. I have years of experience treating bulimia, binge eating, anorexia, and issues of body image, with excellent results.


In addition to seeing patients individually for eating disorders (among other issues), I'm currently forming an ongoing, weekly therapy group for persons with eating disorders who are looking for something more ongoing and intensive. I work on a sliding fee scale, so I will do what I can to make it work for you. My approach is a combination of psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and Buddhist principles, with a healthy dose of compassion and understanding!

Our meetups are held in Union Square, near 12th Street and University Place.

Please give me a call or email me if you think you might be interested in attending the meet-ups or in learning more about individual or group therapy. Space is somewhat limited, so if you are interested, it's best to call or email me right away.


Thank you!


Judie Stein, Ph.D., L.M.S.W.
Director
Stein Mediation & Family Center


(212)[masked]
[masked]

www.steinmediation.com

results.description:
Networking sucks, but it doesn’t have to. Join us on Saturday, March 12th at Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, NJ as we guide you through the art of relationship building and promotion in-person events!.

Promoting your biz at networking events can feel overwhelming. Where do you find out about events? How can you avoid sounding too “salesy” when you’re talking about yourself? What’s the best way to follow up with a new connection?

Part workshop and part networking event, you’ll get the answers to those questions – plus you’ll uncover little known ways to meet people, learn to communicate more effectively with your body language and words, and pick up tips to craft connections where ever you are.

RSVP REQUIRED!!

Our Presenter: Sam Popp @sampoppnyc

Business cards, a friend if you'd like, & an open mind.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

[FEBRUARY 6, 13, 20, 27] - MARCH - APRIL -- 12:30pm

WHO CAN ATTEND:
Beginning guitar students who have no prior knowledge of how to play guitar, or people who can play, but are unfamiliar with how to read and play from written notes.  NOTE:  Session #1 is MANDATORY for participation in the Series.


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:
Learn to READ and PLAY NOTES, CHORDS and PLAY SONGS you know and love.  And what you learn is applicable to playing Rock, Blues, Folk, Country, Jazz, Classical or any other type of music the student is interested in playing.

MONTHLY, FOUR-WEEK CYCLES:
In this workshop, a specific set of concepts will be covered over a period of 4-week.  Each monthly, 4-week period will be closed to people who did not attend the 1st session of the month.  This allow the group to continue to progress through the lesson material and avoid the need to review all that came before each time a new person joins the group. There will be three to four monthly, 4-week cycles before the first cycle is repeated

• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Also bring a three-ring binder and a pencil

results.description:
"Cary Grant was an English actor who became an American citizen in 1942. Known for his transatlantic accent, debonair demeanor, and dashing good looks, Grant is considered one of classic Hollywood's definitive leading men"  - and yet, he never won an Oscar. We think he deserved one. From light-hearted comedy to more serious roles, Grant did it all. Two of Cary Grant's most fun roles were in the comedies Bringing Up Baby and Arsenic and Old Lace.

Bringing Up Baby (1938) is one of versatile director Howard Hawks' greatest screwball comedies and often considered the definitive screwball film. It is also one of the funniest, wackiest and most inspired films of all time with its characteristic breathless pace, zany antics and pratfalls, absurd situations and misunderstandings, perfect sense of comic timing, completely screwball cast, series of lunatic and hare-brained misadventures, disasters, light-hearted surprises and romantic comedy. The non-stop, harum-scarum farce skewered many institutions, including psychiatry, the sterile field of science, the police, and high-society upper classes.

Arsenic and Old Lace (1944) is a frenzied, hilarious, madcap black comedy from celebrated director Frank Capra. The slapstick film, with murderous aunts compassionately serving up elderberry wine to elderly gentlemen - with their crazy nephew assisting by burying the unfortunate victims, is unlike most of the other reform-minded Capra-corn films with a social conscience that became his trademark, e.g., Mr. Deeds Goes to Town (1936), Meet John Doe (1941), or Mr. Smith Goes to Washington (1939). It is more similar in tone to his screwball romantic comedy It Happened One Night (1934) and to Capra's other adaptation from a Broadway play You Can't Take It With You (1938). Cary Grant does a marvelous job of exaggerated acting with constant mugging and other facial plasticity, amazing double-takes, slapstick and general befuddlement.

We'll meet at 12:30 PM on the corner of Ganesvoort and Washington streets under the start of the High Line and we'll get to know each other while we wait for everyone to arrive. 

The walk will start at EXACTLY 1 PM.  If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late. The group will not wait and my phone will be off. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing under the start of the High Line and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. 

When you come to a Date Walking event, you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 5 to 15 wo/men over the course of around an hour or two. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face. You can check out some photos from previous Date Walks here. 

While this event is geared towards singles in the 21 to 49 age range, anyone of any age is welcome to attend. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here.

results.description:
Meet to share and discuss SF and fantasy writing, books, films, TV shows, the writing process, the publishing industry, etc. with other SF and fantasy writers (both published and unpublished).  We usually have a long and lively discussion, followed by critiques of stories or chapters (if any) that members brought along.  We don't always have stories to critique, but we usually enjoy having hours worth of discussion, so let us know near the beginning of the Meetup if you brought something to have critiqued so we don't use up all our time talking -- time flies when you're having fun!

Further details or topics for this Meetup may be announced later.

As usual, you can bring a chapter or short story for the group to critique, but it's by no means necessary.  If you do bring your MS, try to bring enough paper copies for everyone attending to have one, and if you want us to write comments or corrections on it, then please double-space it.  We usually ask the author to read it aloud (unless you're shy), which is very helpful, because you'd be surprised how often you don't catch your own mistakes until you read your manuscript aloud for the first time! 

For the manuscript (MS) critiques, length is not set in stone, but suggested length is 1500 words, maximum length 3000 words. In pages (Times 12 point font), 1500 words is just under five pages double spaced, or about three pages single-spaced (but you should always double-space to allow room for people to write comments or corrections!)  Don't worry if your MS is longer than 1500 words, you can still bring it, but please keep it under 3,000 words.

For more guidelines on critiques, see http://www.meetup.com/The-Woodbridge-Science-Fiction-Fantasy-Writers-Meetup/about/
results.name: Share and discuss writing with other SF and fantasy writers

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Before you R.S.V.P. yes, you must get your free admission ticket here.

Once inside, feel free to go through the museum at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members. 


Launched in 1943, the former aircraft carrier USS Intrepid fought in World War II, surviving five kamikaze attacks and one torpedo strike. The ship later served in the Cold War and the Vietnam War. Intrepid also served as a NASA recovery vessel in the 1960s. It was decommissioned in 1974, and today is berthed on the Hudson River as the centerpiece of the Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum.


The Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum is dedicated to the exhibition and interpretation of history, science and service as related to its home aboard the aircraft carrier Intrepid, a National Historic Landmark. As you explore the Museum, you will be able to examine original artifacts, view historic video footage and explore interactive exhibits.

results.description:
Another first for Gay Planeswalkers! We're going to get together to play Ingress. If you've never played before, it's an augmented-reality massively multiplayer online location-based game played with a smart phone or a tablet with internet access. Think Foursquare but instead you're fighting to claim portals and defend them from enemies. It might also be compared to a scavenger hunt where the other team tries to steal your stuff.

In order to play, you need a smartphone or internet-connected tablet. You'll also need a fair amount of battery life so if you have an external charger, more power to you.

There are two teams in Ingress. I'm Team Enlightened but there's also Team Resistance. Don't join a team yet if you've never played.

Currently this event is for either team. We'll all meet up at the Time Warner building and then split up to claim as much of Central Park as we can during the next two hours before we go and grab some food and drinks on the Upper West Side at Isabella's.

Please let me know which team you are on (if any) so I can plan.

If the temperature is cold, we'll instead try to claim as much of the Columbus Circle Lincoln Center area.
results.name: Let's play Gay Ingress

results.description:
Bonjour !

Starting our walk at the former Daily News headquarters (the Superman fans will appreciate…), we will go East first to discover U Thant Island by the UN and the UN French Mission.

Then we will pass by a great spot to enjoy the Manhattan solstice, then the Graybar building, and the Fred. F. French building (http://www.nyc-architecture.com/MID/MID145.htm), a famous example of Babylon-enriched architecture.

Nearby, we might as well enjoy the Brill building, some sections of the Berlin Wall, and spotting the pigs of Saint Patrick’s (yes, pigs gargoyles!).

The grand bouquet will be the Marilyn Monroe subway grate (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ej5vaUwDsp8).

Avec nostalgie, going southwards, we will end our walk by the remaining eagles of old Penn Station, 6,000 pounds of solid marble each, once part of the imperial facade of the beloved old Penn Station….

NOTICE THAT :

-The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:00 PM. 

DIRECTIONS ? 

220 East 42nd street

Transport: 4,5,6,7 and S trains/Grand Central-42nd st

-If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, just please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". There is no need to post why you can't make the event. Merci !

In case my phone number is[masked]/[masked]

A bientôt !Alex
results.name: U Thant Island to the French Building + tons of ‘Insolites” !

group.name: French conversation in NY - An Invitation to the Voyage !

results.description:
The weather is warming and we’re doing another one of our ever popular Gallery Hops in the well established westside photo gallery district of Chelsea with our leader Rita Russo. We’ll be revisiting and walking through the area to see what’s new and combine our hopping (from gallery to gallery) with some photos of the neighborhood.  We’ll meet at 1 PM in front of the Dallas BBQ Restaurant on the NW corner of Eighth Avenue and 23rd Street (the C and E trains stop right on the corner and the #1 train is just a block away).   Please be on time.   A list of galleries and approximate times of our visits will be distributed and published here as well.  Bring your camera if you would like to do some shooting along the way or after.  The nearby Highline has been extended to 34th Street and the new #7 Westside Javits Ctr station has opened.  

RSVP at right.  Be sure to dress for the weather (might still be chilly)!

We'll meet up at the end and grab a bite to eat here: Pepe Giallo Restaurant, [masked]th Ave (24-25 St), <a>[masked]</a>, PepeGiallo.com. 

There is no charge for this event except your Dutch meal or beverage.
results.how_to_find_us: Photo Gallery Go'ers Meeting In Front of Dallas BBQ, NW Corner 8th Ave. & 23rd St.
results.name: CHELSEA PHOTO GALLERY HOP: Saturday, March 12, 2016, 1 PM!

On the southern shores of the Moonsea, the residents of Mulmaster have eked out a living where others would likely have given up long ago—in a bleak city where corruption is rampant and the Church of Bane holds sway.

Join both veteran and new players of D&D for this Adventures league event.

results.description: We play Settlers the second Saturday, and the third Sunday of every month. We play a mix of traditional (3-4 player) or expansion (5-6 player) Settlers as well as Knights & Cities and/or Seafarers. Recently, we have been trying new Settlers games like Starfarers and Fishermen - both of which we like. Newbies are always welcome. We'll teach you the game. And for those of you who have a board, please bring it. We look forward to playing with you! Also, to ensure that we have enough boards for all attendees, please bring your board and mention it in your RSVP. Thanks

results.description:
Project Cicero is an annual non-profit book drive designed to create and supplement classroom libraries in under-resourced New York City public schools.

Since its inception in 2001, Project Cicero has distributed 2.3 million new and gently used books to more than 13,000 New York City classrooms, reaching over 550,000 students. We receive donations from more than 100 independent, public, and parochial schools each year, and also receive generous contributions from many publishers.


Friday March 11th, Saturday March 12th and Sunday March 13th 
Volunteers needed to help Project Cicero organize, display and distribute gently-used children's books to teachers from under-resourced public schools in NYC. Over 150,000 books will be processed. 
It's fun, it's satisfying, it's a New York City unique event. Come be a part of the happening! 
NOTE: If you are a teacher or librarian wishing to take books for your school, please register at www.projectcicero.org starting Feb. 1st. Registering here DOES NOT allow you to collect books to take home. This is volunteering to help ONLY. 
We recommend signing up as soon as possible when registration opens on Feb. 1st. To Register as a Volunteer please follow below link:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/2016-project-cicero-individual-volunteer-registration-for-helping-not-for-taking-books-home-select-registration-19715272912?utm_campaign=order_confirmation_email&utm_medium=email&ref=eemailordconf&utm_source=eb_email&utm_term=eventname

Please select the hours you intend to participate. For example, if coming from 1:00-4:00, then select a ticket in each category 1:00-2:00, 2:00-3:00 and 3:00-4:00. This allows us to plan appropriately knowing at each hour how many volunteers we can expect. 
It is not binding. We will be in touch before the event, and if your plans change, we can be reached at: [masked] 
Thank you and we look forward to having you on board! 
FAQs 
If I am part of a group, do I register here? 
If your group organizer is taking care of it, then you do not have to register separately. BUT if you group is asking each member to register by yourself, then YES, please register here and there will be a slot to write the name of your group (XXX from Stuyvesant, or XXX Alumni Group, XXX School Track Team, etc.) 
If you are a group organizer overseeing multiple attendees, you can contact us at [masked] to discuss a group registration in lieu of having each attendee register separately. 
Where can I contact Project Cicero with any questions? 
[masked] 
Can I update or cancel my registration information? 
1. Go to www.eventbrite.com/login and enter the email address and password that you used at the time you registered. (Forgot your password or didn't set one? Click this link to set a new password) http://help.eventbrite.com/customer/en_us/portal/articles/428920-reset-password 
2. Once you've logged in, click on the My Tickets tab at the top of the screen. 
3. Click on View Order below your event name to display the information collected during registration. 
4. Click the Edit link to update the information and Save to save the changes. 
Do I have to bring a printed ticket to the event? 
No, your name will be on a list. 
The name on the registration/ticket doesn't match the attendee. Is that okay? 
Yes, that is fine if the person attending tells us when arriving and checking in.
results.name: Project Cicero

group.name: ! A Fun & Adventures With Strangers - New York

results.description:
Storytelling is an empowering and enriching tool for building confidence, self-awareness and creativity. This is a 3-week workshop to EMPOWER you to tell your STORY, with your own VOICE, in your own WAY. 

Did you know that public speaking is one of the biggest fears next to death? So, it’s no surprise that many people have a difficult time expressing and articulating their thoughts, feelings and opinions in front of an audience, whether it be an audience of one or one hundred. 

• Are you looking to enhance your ability to speak more effectively?

• Have you had a difficult time engaging in conversations with others in social gatherings?

• Are you a little shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking?

• Are you a professional hoping to be more confident during work meetings and in interactions with co-workers? 

In this class you will obtain that and a whole lot more! I'm confident that you will leave more knowledgeable, self-confident, motivated and enthusiastic, to tackle the challenges of daily life, whether at work or in your personal life. 

This workshop is designed with interactive activities to teach the basics of good storytelling. You will learn how to create fun, engaging, and stimulating stories, and have a chance to practice speaking and sharing those stories with personalized feedback.

YOU WILL LEARN:

•  How to tell your story effectively

• How to engage in personal practices that will assist you in building your confidence

• How to make any story interesting and engaging by adding your own uniqueness

• Why your story is important

• How learning to craft your story leads to more confidence, freedom and empowerment

WHO IS THIS CLASS IS FOR? 

Anyone who wants to strengthen their skills in storytelling to transform themselves in social interactions, work presentations, and build overall confidence when engaging with others

LOGISTICS:


• Please bring water.


• Door closes at 1:15pm, so please get there before then or else you might be locked out.

CLASS DATES:

• Workshop 1: Saturday, Feb 27


• Workshop 2: Saturday, Mar 5


• Workshop 3: Saturday, Mar 12

INSTRUCTOR:

Pasha Cook is a life and personal development coach. She facilitates athlete transition workshops, leadership development trainings, and character-building seminars. She has a mission to empower others with her encouraging message, “Discovering Your Inner Champion.” 


Learn more about Pasha at pashacook.com.
results.name: Storytelling Workshop: Your Story, Your Voice, Your Way (3-WEEK SERIES)

results.description: Eberron is a world where magic is technology, in which air ships, lightning rails, elemental galleons, and living constructs exist side by side with swords, armor, and sorcery. It is a world recovering from a continent wide civil war, where the five nations struggled with each other for the crown of Galifar. The Last War ended with the annihilation of an entire country by a mysterious magical cataclysm. While open war has ended, a shadow war among spies, nobles, dragonmarked houses, cults, and monsters has risen in its place. Join the adventure. Current players are level 2. Pre-made characters are available for drop-ins.

results.description:
Hot Pot.. One of those quintessential predominantly Asian things here in the city that crosses all cultures boundaries indicative of something earthy, stewy and delicious. 99 Favor Taste (Yes, that's the full/real name) captures this by providing you with delicious scalding pots of broth to cook raw ingredients in copious unlimited amounts of your choosing.


The way this works; you pick one broth type per person, you then (each) get to pick any of the 50+ raw ingredients to cook in your broth to your heart's content. Again, UNLIMITED. So you can get Spinach, Watercress, Lamb, Lotus Root, Pumpkin, Shrimp, Chicken, Crab, Mushroom, All types of Beef, Eggplant etc on and on until you are stuffed and bloated out of your hot pot loving mind. They also have a condiment and herb bar that you can pick up any combination of items to make your meal that much more tasty. 


This is an ancient Chinese dining style that has persevered through the years. If you've never done it you should, and if you have done it you need to join us for this one. 99 Favor Taste is one of the best dining deals in the city. At $18.99 + tax and tip per person you can't go wrong. It's a full meal at a family style table where you cook your own goods to delicious perfection.


My boy Frank has never had the pleasure and coming off of our 1st event; The Ramen Doubleheader, I am sure this will be another fantastic voyage for his delicate and inexperienced mouth. Join us for this fantastic voyage into healthy, delicious (and not the norm) Chinese food.



Remember: These events are highly interactive. We will be capturing video and taking pictures to supplement for the Culinary Foolinary podcast and website. We would love your involvement in this process to round out our mission of food education, fun and overall deliciousness.


In advance, Ganbei (Cheers) See you there!

Follow Us!: CulinaryFoolinary.com
Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
results.how_to_find_us: Come into 99Favor Taste and enjoy everything. There are no reservations so please be on time.
results.name: What's a Hot Pot and Why You Want It? (99 Favor Taste in Chinatown)

We fence foil predominantly, but if you fence epee or saber, let me know and I'll bring mine.  It also helps if you leave a comment if you're going to the meetup and you'd like to fence epee or saber.


We will be charging $15 per meeting to cover the cost of renting the studio.  There is a significant discount for purchasing the entire semester which includes 14 2 hour classes.


We will do our best to provide instruction appropriate for each individuals skill level. 

We have some equipment to lend, but if you would like to borrow, please contact me at least 24 hours before the meetup, and let me know if you are left handed.


The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://maps.google.com/maps?q=380+broadway&hl=en&ll=40.718209,-74.002908&spn=0.006034,0.012703&sll=40.718109,-74.002904&layer=c&cbp=13,90.98,,1,-3.47&cbll=40.718122,-74.00297... ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

Beginners are welcome. Experienced fencers welcome. Everybody's welcome!

- Mike

Boozy Brunch is at West 3rd Common. Any Entree with Unlimited Bloody Marys, Mimosas, and Screwdrivers for 3 (THREE!) hours is just $30 (plus tax and tip). CASH ONLY. Take a peek at the menu: http://west3rdcommon.com/menus/brunch/

Please only RSVP NO if you are changing your RSVP from a YES to a NO

You will be asked for a $2 fee when RSVP'ing.  This fee covers the cost of holding reservations when needed, helps keep the group going, and holds people accountable for following through with their RSVP's.  I use my own information to make reservations and will be charged for no shows. We want to maintain positive relationships with all places that we attend so that we will be invited back and possibly offered perks! :-)  

PAYMENTS SHOULD BE MADE THROUGH PAYPAL.  You will be refunded only if you change your RSVP to NO at least 4 days prior to the event, if the event is rescheduled, or if the event is canceled.

Two late cancellations or no shows will lead to removal from the group. 

CASH ONLY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Seriously!  THEY DO NOT TAKE CARDS!

Winning combo.

results.description:
Join us tomorrow to put a little SALSA in your life. 

Each and every saturday we have a little salsa for all ages and all levels. 

• Latin Kids Ensemble: 1-2PM 

Kid's are welcome to join the "Latin Kids Ensemble" from 1-2pm.  In this class kids learn about Latin Culture and its rhythm.  We focus on teaching them the roots of music and how to feel it in their souls. 

• Salsa Level 1: 2-3PM

Two left feet? Never danced before? Want to learn how to salsa? Come join us.. No experience necessary, and no partner needed. Just bring your dancing shoes, and your positive energy y VAMOS A BAILAR!!! WHEPPA!!!

• Salsa Level 2: 3-4PM 

Salsa Level 2 requires you to have previous salsa experience. You should know the fundamentals of the basics, and an open mind to learn.  In this class we will cover footwork, partner-work, body movement, spinning, and styling techniques.  


***Note: Please wear comfy attire. WE WILL BE HAVING A NICE SALSA WORKOUT!!!
results.name: Salsita Saturday's

group.name: Peak Latin Dancing group in Bergen County, (Ridgefield) NJ

results.description:
Learn to Salsa New York Style with Yrma Arias at El Taller! This style of Salsa, "On 2", has gained popularity over the last decade in NYC. The classes will focus on the look and feel of the dance - with an emphasis on timing, footwork and partner work. Classes will provide instruction and repetition of the steps ‘Shines’, introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection, and provide practical techniques for the Latin Motion. Particular attention is paid to rhythm and musicality. This is an enjoyable class designed for people of all ages. The most important lesson is to have fun! What to bring: A great attitude and comfortable clothes and shoes that allow you to move!


When you arrive at 215 E. 99th Street, press the El T button on the intercom and we'll buzz you right in!
results.name: Beginner Salsa Dancing

group.name: Spanish, Salsa, and Tango at El Taller!

results.description:
The Hike Is a Sierra Club Event!

6  - 7-mile walk through Crocheron Park and over the Cross Island Parkway, down the Brooklyn-Queens Greenway, past Bayside Marina, through Fort Totten and back.

Bring some water, Bananas or Granola Bars. Bug Repellant and Sunblock.

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

Duration approx 3+ hours,  approx 6-7 + miles

===>>>  IMPORTANT... WHERE TO MEET

We'll meet IN THE PARKING LOT of Crocheron Park !!! There might be signs to take you to the other side of the park. Please ensure you come to the PARKING LOT!

Use this link for Google maps or put this address into your GPS:

[masked]th Place, Bayside, Queens, NY 11361

===>>>  AFTER-PARTY!!!

After the Hike, you are welcome to optionally join us for some well deserved Food / Drinks at Tony Romas.

Happy Hour Menu and Drink Specials. 

Freshly Prepared - Served Hot - Homemade Chips.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
results.how_to_find_us: we meet in the Crocheron Park parking lot
results.name: Fort Totten/Bayside Marina HIKE + Afterparty @ Tony Romas!

6  - 7-mile walk through Crocheron Park and over the Cross Island Parkway, down the Brooklyn-Queens Greenway, past Bayside Marina, through Fort Totten and back.

Bring some water, Bananas or Granola Bars. Bug Repellant and Sunblock.

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

Duration approx 3+ hours,  approx 6-7 + miles


===>>>  IMPORTANT... WHERE TO MEET

We'll meet IN THE PARKING LOT of Crocheron Park !!! There might be signs to take you to the other side of the park. Please ensure you come to the PARKING LOT!

Use this link for Google maps or put this address into your GPS:

[masked]th Place, Bayside, Queens, NY 11361

===>>>  AFTER-PARTY!!!

After the Hike, you are welcome to optionally join us for some well deserved Food / Drinks at Tony Romas.

Happy Hour Menu and Drink Specials. 

Freshly Prepared - Served Hot - Homemade Chips.

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

results.description:
This is the second Nordic Walking class of the day and is done at a more relaxed pace.  We start across from the Museum of Natural History and wind around the reservoir for a total of approximately 2.5 miles.  The pace is relaxed at 20/min per mile and takes approximately 55 minutes.  This is an ideal class if you have never done Nordic Walking or you prefer a more moderate cardio level.  Nobody gets left behind!
We supply the poles and wireless audio.  Please do not bring handbags.  Backpacks or belt bags are fine.  For more details, view <a>www.HYVÄnordicwalking.com</a>

Sonja/Bill
results.how_to_find_us: This Nordic Walk meets directly across the street from the Museum of Natural History.  There is an entrance to Central Park on CPW and approximatley 79t st.
results.name: Spring Nordic Walk Level 1 (Relaxed)

results.description:
Welcome to the group! We're going to host fun events, classes, get-togethers and outings all year round. While it's still cold, I'm inviting you to join me in this Bear Yoga class. It's super gentle and you don't need any prior experience.

Words from the instructor...

"Winter is here, so we're offering a sleepytime Bear Yoga practice to help greet it! We'll use honey-slow movement, snuggly blankets and cushy bolsters to gently stretch the body and quiet the mind. Just lay back and let gravity happen!"

- $15 per class (or $45 for a block of 4 classes)

- You do NOT need to bring your own mat (unless you'd like to)

- Wear whatever you'll be comfortable in (shirt and sweatpants or shorts)

Find more info and FAQs at http://bearyoga.rocks/

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

All levels practice. Coached by Granger.

This practice is about water polo. Emphasis is on playing and learning the game by playing. Some of us have been playing since childhood. Others have picked it up as adults. We're friendly and inclusive, but we play hard.

Requirements:

-You have to join New York Recreation. $75 for 6 months for access to all rec centers and pools in the city. If you're under 25, you pay $25 for 1 year. http://www.nycgovparks.org/programs/recreation-centers/membership

-Beginners are welcome, but you must be a good swimmer.

-You MUST bring a lock for a gym locker.

-You should bring an athletic bathing suit, goggles, and a towel. Bring a swim cap if you have long hair.

--------------------------

Absolute Rules

----------------------

results.description:
Hey all. This month we're reading A Head Full of Ghosts by Paul Tremblay: 

A chilling thriller that brilliantly blends domestic drama, psychological suspense, and a touch of modern horror, reminiscent of Mark Z. Danielewski’s House of Leaves, John Ajvide Lindqvist’s Let the Right One In, and Shirley Jackson’s The Haunting of Hill House.

The lives of the Barretts, a normal suburban New England family, are torn apart when fourteen-year-old Marjorie begins to display signs of acute schizophrenia.

To her parents’ despair, the doctors are unable to stop Marjorie’s descent into madness. As their stable home devolves into a house of horrors, they reluctantly turn to a local Catholic priest for help. Father Wanderly suggests an exorcism; he believes the vulnerable teenager is the victim of demonic possession. He also contacts a production company that is eager to document the Barretts’ plight. With John, Marjorie’s father, out of work for more than a year and the medical bills looming, the family agrees to be filmed, and soon find themselves the unwitting stars of The Possession, a hit reality television show. When events in the Barrett household explode in tragedy, the show and the shocking incidents it captures become the stuff of urban legend.

Fifteen years later, a bestselling writer interviews Marjorie’s younger sister, Merry. As she recalls those long ago events that took place when she was just eight years old, long-buried secrets and painful memories that clash with what was broadcast on television begin to surface—and a mind-bending tale 

Come hang out, talk stories, and help us pick the next books.
results.how_to_find_us: We are usually seated in the back.
results.name: A Head Full of Ghosts by Paul Tremblay

The Prudential Center, 165 Mulberry Street, Newark, NJ, 07102

TIME: 2:00-4:00 pm

MAP: http://www.mapquest.com/?version=1.0&hk=8-88kqUwFN

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: from NYC -Penn Station in NYC, one train stop to Newark Penn Station. Go outside and you will see the large Prudential Center sign on top of the building approx 1 block away.

DETAILS ON PARKING: There is parking on sidestreets everywhere in the vicinity of Mulberry & Lafayette Streets, and a number of municipal lots in the local area as well. Please think ahead and bring some quarters for metered parking, if you aren't lucky enough to find free parking (which is ample!)

Sunday March 13, 2-4 pm, 6-8 pm


Please help FAUN and our friends/allies stand up for animals enslaved by the heartless, horrific enterprise known as Ringling Bros Circus. Animals are enslaved, abused and forced to spend their dismal, horrendous lives engaging in behaviors wholly unnatural to them, performing under constant threat of pain and punishment by this ravenous cash machine of a "circus". and get treated like garbage even as those who survive all the horror, a joyless life of mechanistic use and abuse, approach convalescence.

Again, we will have signs, leaflets and relevant props. If you have something you want to bring, that's fine, but all you NEED to bring is YOURSELF, a heart full of empathy/compassion and a voice to demonstrate your love for pachyderms, primates, bears, big cats, all creatures great and small.

Blessed be ALL animals, FIGHT for their rights!!!

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. I will comment on some things (the architecture and social history of some of the buildings) along the way, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others. We will be stopping at a number of points of interest. (IF YOU DON'T LIKE THIS STOPPING, THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU.) This walk is about 2 1/2 to 3 miles and moderate paced. 

I also scheduled this same walk on Sunday, March 13th.

HAVE EXTRA LAYERS OF CLOTHING. PLEASE DRESS PROPERLY FOR THE WINTER CONDITONS.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. 

Description: In celebration of Women's History Month, we will be discussing women architects, artists, designers, journalists, models, sculptors, and socialites from the late 19th century to the early 20th century. We'll talk about the battle for the top socialite of New York City; the "Tiffany Girls" rediscovered; the "sob sisters" sentimental appeal; architectural details with a feminine touch; the sculptress labeled the "poor little rich girl"; and female artist models whose face and figure we still see all around NYC.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:00 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the front entrance to the Time Warner Center, which is at 10 Columbus Circle at 59th Street and Broadway. Before the walk, restrooms are available on the south and north sides of the 2nd and 3rd floors at Time Warner Center. There will be limited places to stop for a restroom along the way.

Transportation Options: Take the A, B, C, D, or 1 subway train to 59th Street and Columbus Circle.

Finishing Time/Place: This walk will finish about 4:45 PM at the Upper East Side on East 66th Street between Park Avenue and Lexington Avenue. 

Rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions or the forecast is for rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning. This walk will only happen in good weather conditions. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board.


Below was Alva Vanderbilt, a prominent socialite, at her fancy-dress ball in 1883. She and her husband built an opulent French chateau-style mansion on Fifth Avenue, and the ball served as a housewarming party. She was married to William Kissam Vanderbilt, the grandson of transportation tycoon Cornelius Vanderbilt. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883]) 

(Photographer Jose Maria Mora was able to mingle easily with the upper classes of New York City and became the photographer of choice for the constant fancy-dress balls, tableaux, and other events of this era that required the upper class to get dressed up…which they did amazingly often.)

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

Below was Mrs. Seward Webb at Alva Vanderbilt's fancy-dress ball in 1883. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883])

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

Below was Miss Bessie Webb at Alva Vanderbilt's fancy-dress ball in 1883. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883])

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In 1895, Alva Vanderbilt divorced her husband William Kissam Vanderbilt because he cheated on her and then, a year later, married Oliver Hazard Perry Belmont. After Belmont died in 1908, she became an unlikely heroine of the women's rights movement and used her fortune to advance women's rights. 

Below was Alva Belmont, formerly Alva Vanderbilt, standing between Mrs. J.B. Batteli (left) and Elsie Hill at the dedication of the new headquarters of the National Woman's Party in Washington D.C. on May 1, 1922. (Source The New York Times)

Below is from The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, September 5, 1929.
results.name: History of Women during the Gilded Age and Beyond Walk (Mar 12)

group.name: NYC/NJ Walks: Explore Architecture, Art, History & Sculpture

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!
results.name: Saturday Python Study Group

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-inside-the-historic-weeksville-hunterfly-road-houses-tickets-21723162564?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club as we go inside the Weeksville Heritage Center’s (WHC) Hunterfly Road Houses; located on an old Native American trail and later a colonial road, these houses are examples of the homes of 19th century free African Americans in the urban North. Named for James Weeks, who purchased the land in 1838, Weeksville was originally settled by African Americans from all over the east coast following slavery’s end in New York State in 1827.

Our experience will take us inside the historic Hunterfly Road Houses, which are set up to show how people lived — there are no ropes over furniture, and no glass cases holding valuable objects, many of which were made in the late 1800’s and early 1900’s.

Afterwards, we'll grab food and drinks in the neighborhood!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Inside the Historic Weeksville Hunterfly Road Houses

results.description:
The purpose of this meeting is to craft our agenda based on the youth needs and thoughts, communicate their concerns, meet other peers, learn new skills, and encourage them to work together in addressing issues that directly affect their well-being and progress.

As you might be aware, for the past 77 years, the Federation of Hellenic Societies of Greater New York has been organizing and hosting the Greek Independence Day Parade, which annually takes place on Fifth Avenue, in Manhattan. This time of the year we need volunteers to help us run our Parade event, and basically assist us with our office work on a weekly or bi-weekly basis. So, if you are willing to give us some of your time and talents, roll up your sleeves, and jump in! We would be more than happy to have you on board and provide references to all volunteers who complete a minimum number of 40 hours.
As a volunteer at the Federation you will meet new people, develop your cultural awareness and enjoy the personal satisfaction that comes from helping others. You may learn new skills, or gain experience which may assist you in your career or educational pursuits. Including volunteer experience in your resume may also help if you are seeking employment.
results.name: 2nd Youth Meeting | The Federation of Hellenic Societies of Greater New York

Saturday, March 12th, 2:00pm, Library Auditorium. 

"Castles of New Jersey." Lecture and Discussion

 Although not as numerous or grand as their European counterparts, a surprisingly large number of castles were built in New Jersey a century or more ago. 

This program will take you on a tour of well-known castles such as Lambert (Where we are having out Gatsby Ball Feb 13) and Kip's castles as well as lesser known ones throughout the state.

 Many of them still exist, some have been disguised over the years, and others have vanished.
All are welcome.

Enjoy!  Robert

results.description:
Change of event:

The original event is basics of Git and Vim.  This section was defined as set up.

Going forward will be basics of Vim, and then Git.  I plan on going over the philosophy of each.  Why use Vim?  and Why use Git?

Vim is a versatile text editor with a steep learning curve.  It is available on most Unix-like systems by default, and is mostly cross platform (Windows/Linux/Bsd/Osx/Android).

Topics:

    - Movements

    - Modes

    - Buffers

    - Maps

    - Vimrc

    - A taste of using Python in Vim

    - Brief overview of plugins.

Following that I would like to go over some basics of Git, and approach it from a high level.  This will be a shorter introduction to Git than previous tutorials.

It also seems that a brief introduction to Bash and the commandline is in order.

Time withstanding I would also like to demonstrate using Git remotely.  Traditionally Github is used, and many of the same principles will apply.  As Git is a Distributed Version Control System, I want to demonstrate the distributed part through SSH.

I understand that these are all topics that can be talk about a tutorial each.  However I am also of the opinion that hearing and understanding high level reasons is more important than immediate knowledge recollection and memorization.  Especially when it comes to learning Vim.  The aim is for everybody to become familiar with these concepts so they can be applied in the future.

Please have a computer capable of running Bash, Vim, and Git.  If you're on Linux or OSX you probably already meet this criteria.  If you're on Windows Git comes with something called "Git-Bash."  A binary of Vim can also be downloaded.

This is a free event.
results.name: TUTORIAL: Basics of Vim and Git
