Nerium AD night treatment

is the hottest thing around when it comes to anti-aging skin care. As seen on the View, the Doctors, and in countless beauty blogs and magazines.. This easy to use night treatment addresses multiple concerns such as fine lines and wrinkles, discoloration, uneven skin tone, enlarged pores, and sagging loose skin. Clear out your medicine cabinet, clear out your bathroom drawers, this 1 bottle does it all. If you would like to learn more visit kristinaandmike.theneriumlook.com or contact Kristina Brown directly at[masked] or[masked]. Also if you are concerned about cellulite or loose skin on the body inquire about the Nerium Firm Body Contouring cream, it sells out every spring so get your inquiries in early.


Healthy Healing

: Westbury-

Specializing in Women’s Health, Fertility,

Pain & Stress Reduction.

Sharon McDermott, M.S., L.Ac. is a licensed acupuncturist and board certified Chinese Herbologist.  Sharon will take the time to assess your condition and provide the best individualized treatment approach. Sharon specializes in women's health including, menstrual irregularities, infertility, menopausal transition, pain and stress reduction. Please contact her at[masked]-4297.  Sharon creates individualized acupuncture and Chinese herbal formulas to address your needs.

================================================== 

------------------------------------------------------------------ 

What the New York Times said

Marcelle S. Fischler from the New York Times covered our first girls night out event.

Click here

for the full article. Some excerpts from the article include:


"The hardest thing is to establish a circle of friends, a circle of single people," Ms. Cardenas said. "The idea of having a fun time for myself and meeting single women is very attractive. It takes away the scariness of doing the single thing, and puts a fun element in it."


"As the friends they have known from young adulthood commit to relationships, marry and have children, single women in their 30's, 40's and 50's, especially in the suburbs, often find themselves out of the loop. Tagging along with couples becomes awkward, and the common ground of shared experience dwindles. The single friend may feel stuck in a rerun of "Sex and the City" while the married friend has moved on to the Wisteria Lane of "Desperate Housewives."


"A lot of women my age are married or have kids," Dr. Hughes said. "They are just on a different path in their lives. They are not interested in going out or doing anything with the singles scene. I am still looking to go out, to meet men."


Not only would they have a chance to commiserate with other unattached women over fresh fruit, sushi and cucumber water, they would also choose from a menu of pampering treatments, from mini-facials to professional makeup applications, having their hair blown out and attending a group lesson on skin care.


Afterward, relaxed, primped and perhaps bonded, the 18 women would move straight on to the more traditional half of the double-barreled event: a men-and-women singles party at Cirella's, a restaurant in the mall.


"Meeting women and men - it's a good two options," Ms. Cardenas said. "Doing the spa thing, if all goes wrong, you walk away with your facial. If all goes right, you make some new friends. If it goes extremely well, you walk out with a potential guy's phone number or being asked your phone number."


At singles events for men and women, Dr. Hughes said, she often got "that standoffish thing" from other women. So the women-only mixer at the spa was a refreshing change, a chance to be cohorts instead of rivals. "In this kind of situation, it's a lot more relaxed," she said.

Contact us now at (516)[masked] or (718)[masked] with any questions.
results.name: Girls Night Out (to make new friends)- Blo

results.description:
Eric Asimov, wine critic for The New York Times, has been running a monthly wine "school" column for the newspaper's readers. He selects a region, does a little write-up, and identifies three wines to try. After drinking the wines, people go to the newspaper's on-line comments section to have a conversation about what they've learned and liked. I've had fun doing this for several months, but thought it might be even better with some of you. Let's meet together from time to time, to drink and talk!

The point of this group is to teach and learn from each other.  All levels are welcome, though we do want participation in tasting and discussing the wines from all.  We keep the group small so we can focus on the wines!  Good behavior is a must, as we will be meeting in a private residence.


March details:  We'll be drinking from Pomerol region of Bordeaux this month. Click here to read Asimov's Pomerol article and see which wines we will be drinking! Please indicate in the comments section or by emailing me which wine you plan to bring.  This helps us have a variety of bottles.


What to bring: Each participant will be expected to read Asimov's monthly wine write-up and bring one bottle of wine recommended in the article. He generally identifies three specific bottles, and also lists alternates if the three are not available. I find snooth.com and wine-searcher.com helpful in figuring out which wine shops might have the bottle you are looking for.   Please make every effort to find the specific bottles listed by Asimov. Be sure to post a comment with which wine you will be bringing so that we can have a variety of bottles. Some bottle duplication is fine when our group is large, but we don't want all the same bottle. 

Because wine needs food, each participant should also bring something tasty to eat and share. 

RSVP and Waitlist:  If the Meetup is full, you will be offered the option of placing your name on a Waitlist.  Be aware that the Meetup platform will automatically change your RSVP from "Waitlist" and "Yes" if a spot opens. The expectation is that you will monitor your status on the Waitlist, and remove your name if you no longer want to attend.  

Cost:  The cost of the Asimov Wine School meetups will vary depending on the cost of that month's wine.  Generally it's been somewhere between $15-$70 for the bottle you bring plus the cost of whatever snack you select to share.

venue.name: MakerBar

results.description:
We're getting the gang back together! The Makerbar Robotics SIG is starting up again in the new space with a new project. {And YES, we are secretly working to build an army of robots to take over the world.... And you should Join Us!} 

What's the new project you ask? We're building a BalanceBot! It promises to be an interesting challenge as none of us have experience with 2-wheeled robots, so we'll be learning as we go. 

Our first meeting is free to everyone and will be to decide just what sort of BalanceBot we're going to build. How big is it going to be? What is it going to be made of? Will it be autonomous or RC? What sort of hardware/software will be used to run it? Will it just roll around or will it have any other functions? Sensors? Lasers? 

By the end of the night, we should have answers to those questions and if we're lucky, we'll have a whole bunch of new questions as well.

What do you need to bring? Just an interest in robotics and some ideas for what our new robot is going to be. No robotics, electronics, or micro-controller experience necessary. But, this will be more than just a robot-building group. You are welcome and encouraged to bring your robot if you have one (home-built or store-bought) or any information about robotics you'd like to share.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.] 

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.name: Robotics SIG <Reboot>

results.description:
Hopefully, by now you ladies have heard of the tiny miracle called "Good Passports". In case you haven't, here is how it works: We each pay $37 for a drink passport which includes 37 drinks at 37 different bars. We have 8 weeks to drink our 37 drinks: March 6th to May 8th. 

THE NYC LOADed COCKTAIL PASSPORT

– Enjoy 37 cocktails at 37 different NYC bars & restaurants –

in honor of Women’s History Month

March 6 through May 8, 2016

We will choose 6 to 8 weeks within that time frame to meet up to use all our drinks. At each meeting, we will visit 4 to 5 bars to enjoy the drinks we have already paid for. Get it? If you're confused, reach out anytime.'

***Please note you will need to tip the bartenders at each location! The drinks are paid for but the gratuity, we must handle :-) Plan on leaving $1 or $2 behind as a tip for each drink.

All ladies who wish to participate should purchase their passports no later than March 9th. We will begin our epic bar crawl shortly thereafter. You may purchase the passport for $37 here:

http://goodpassports.com/cocktails/the-loaded-cocktail-passport-2016-37-cocktails-from-37-bars-for-37/

results.description:
Hey Student Leaders!

This is the 1st networking event for Student Leaders in North New Jersey! The purpose for this event is to create connections between different student leaders in the north Jersey area. Think of this event as a similar networking event the SGA or the office Student Life hosts in your university. The difference between this event and the networking event in your university is that we'll have different student leaders from different universities at this event.


This event will be ran in an unconference style. Overall, what this means is that we will have discussion based sessions where you guys (Student Leaders) will bring the topics you would like to talk about, and we'll all give our opinions, suggestions, and comments on the topic.  Sample topics would be the following:

1. How to publicize for an event

2. How to recruit new members

3. How to deal with a lazy Eboard member

4. How to effectively train new eboard members


                                            Get me?


In the education field, they have these unconference events where different educators come together to gain and share knowledge about any topics regarding education; they are called edcamps. We are essentially using that same model, but we'll focus on topics that relate to student-ran organizations. Check out the video below to get an idea of what an unconference event looks like.


                                             Edcamp Video

Agenda for the event

Welcome (Mingle over light refreshments) 7:00pm

Introduction of Inspimind (Network of College Student Leaders) 7:15pm

Student Leaders Ice Breaker 7:25pm

Edcamp Video 7:35pm


Edcamp (Student Leader version) 7:40pm

Closing remarks 8:40pm

9:00pm Adjournment

Registration for event  (Click here to register to attend the event!)


Questions? Send me a message!

-Wilfredo Betance Jr
results.name: College Student Leader networking

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Suddhaso will be joining us this weekend for a guided meditation and discussion session that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 07:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. 

This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) but donations to help cover expenses are appreciated,

Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together!
results.how_to_find_us: Come to 28 E 35th St, Ring 3rd Floor Buzzer
results.name: Peace of Mind with Bhante Suddhaso

results.description:
If you're one of the many single professionals in the city who would like to meet some great people to date, you'll probably want to come to our most popular theme of speed dating for "Single Professionals 30-45".  

This just means you'd like to meet a variety of singles like yourself, and you'd rather not have to endure the randomness and uncertainty that comes with going to a bar.  At our single professionals events we tend to get the highest attendance numbers, so there is someone for everyone!

At our events, the hosts will run as many rounds as they can so you meet as many singles as possible. The time per date will be reduced as the number of guests increase, and you will still be guaranteed a minimum of 10 dates. This format is good for those who like to have an organized introduction to all attendees, even if the date is a bit shorter. 

Must purchase in advance. Tickets NOT sold at the door. 

*Prepay Only Event. NO Tickets Sold At Door.

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/speed3045/dates/Mar-12-2016_at_0700PM

$29 w/ discount code "5" at checkout (first 5 tickets)

*Ticket is also good for entry to our official after party at Croton (108 W. 40th St.)  Find more details for that party at - http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Social/events/228898545/
results.name: SPEED DATING 30-45 (Sold Out For Women!) PREPAY ONLY

Call Sally @[masked] to finalize your reservation if you plan on attending. We need an accurate head count in order to have seating for everyone.

results.description:
Dancing is a great way to meet people! This dance lesson also works as a great ice-breaker and we rotate partners to help you to get to know everyone at the Meetup. 

You'll receive a professional 1 hour Salsa & Bachata lesson. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends. 

Tickets: 

*$15 advance admission is required (limited space) 

Must Prepay at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/salsa127/dates/Mar-12-2016_at_0730PM

*Only 20 tix available at this price (goes up to $25 as event gets closer)  

*Special Note - Payment for this event will include admission to our party immediately following.  

Reminder, space is limited so an RSVP alone won't hold your spot. You need to purchase a ticket to be confirmed. 

Multiple Meetup groups are co-organizing this event so the RSVP's shown here won't reflect total # of members attending.  We expect to have 20-30 members to attend. 

This is not intended to be completely gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. 

Get tickets at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/salsa127/dates/Mar-12-2016_at_0730PM

results.description:
Open topic group run by a trained facilitator for individuals and their partners who identify as transgender, transsexual, cross-dresser, gender variant, or intersex. Takes place the 2nd and 4th Saturdays of each month, starts at 7:30 pm.

The 2nd Saturday is a discussion group and the 4th Saturday is an activity group.

No charge to attend, but a $5.00 donation is welcome.

Please note: Meet-up.com is used to help promote this group and the RSVPs on Meet-up do not accurately reflect the actual attendance of the group.

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

group.name: Open Jams NYC at Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance
Blue: 90’s / 2K / Hip-Hop

Check in Location: Playwright Irish Pub, 27 West 35th Street, Manhattan, New York 10001.
Check out: St. Pat’s Bar & Grill
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: St. Pat’s Bar & Grill @ 11pm (22 West 46th Street, Manhattan, NY)

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
100 Limited Tickets

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.
results.name: Underground Party – Subway Tour!

results.description:
Mention Salsa New York or West Coast Swing New York Meetup at the door and get in for $12 instead of $15 !!

3 Rooms for Dancing ~ 3 DJs ~ 6 Hours of Social Dancing *FREE* Classes presented by Lori Brizzi and YSBD
Please join us this SATURDAY, June 13th 

At 8pm: Your Choice...*FREE* Salsa Lesson with popular French Open WCS Champion and Latin/Standard/Hustle Dancer Sophie Cazeneuve and her partner Rostislav Toporski
or *FREE* Hustle Lesson
or start off your social dancing with DJ PETER playing wcs, salsa, hustle and mixed ballroom
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Guest DJ KS 360 of Behind the Groove  will play classics, funk, house, soul and rare grooves in the Hustle Room from 9pm-2am

DJ PETER TREWIN will be playing a Ballroom Mix from 8pm-1:00am  

DJ BRETT NOMBERG is bringing sexy back with a soulful mix plus a little funk in our WEST COAST SWING ROOM from 9pm-1am    Come enjoy the fun as we join together 3 different dance communities for one exciting evening of partner dancing 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
*For the salsa lovers, DJ JOHNNY O will play salsa on the hour and DJ Peter will play salsa on the 1/2 hour*
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

results.description:
Hi everyone,

We have another exciting choral concert coming up next week with great seats for our Meetup group! The concert is at Carnegie Hall on Sunday, March 12th at 8:00pm.


The concert will feature an array of choral works performed by the National Festival Chorus under the direction of guest conductors, Beth and Brad Holmes. The chorus will perform a selection of works including René Clausen's "O My Luve's Like a Red, Red Rose" and "Lift Your Voice in Praise and Thanksgiving" by G.F. Handel.

The concert includes a performance by Texas A&M University Century Singers, conducted by Eric Posada. Also performing is the Columbia University Wind Ensemble, which will present works by Michael Markowski, Aaron Perrine, Johan de Meij, and Williams Pitts and is conducted by Jason Noble with special guest conductor, Johan de Meij.

Don't miss this fantastic night of music at world-renowned Carnegie Hall!

**Tickets are only $7 each, a great discount (value: $110 for Parquet seating)! You can purchase your ticket(s) directly on this event page. Please note: Once you have booked your tickets, they will be available for collection under your full name (the name listed under your PayPal "Buyer Information" in payment, not your Meetup name) at the box office at Carnegie Hall as early as 4pm on the day of the performance. 

Each individual is responsible for picking up his or her own tickets. Everyone from our Meetup group will be seated together. 

Remember, since this is an exclusive club, we ask that you do not contact the box office at Carnegie Hall. Please contact me with any questions regarding your tickets.

Looking forward to meeting everyone there!
results.name: National Festival Chorus at Carnegie Hall

results.description:
Dear beautiful sisters,

It is my great delight to invite you to ONACNY's first “Women’s Medicine Circle”!

This women-only ceremony will focus on empowering the divine feminine while healing the body, mind and spirit by working with the sacred mother medicine. This ceremony is highly recommended for women who feel called and ready for a new level of self-realization, consciousness expansion, and fearless, purpose driven moments of life.

The opportunity to open your heart, be nurtured, experience unconditional love and release fears comes at a perfect time as we witness our Mother Earth transitioning and evolving herself. This healing journey will be guided by a medicine woman who truly cares and understands the female heart and sensibilities. In such a supported space you are free to express, laugh, release, and cry with a beautiful group of women while creating deep and lasting bonds with your sisters!

This page is for announcement only, RSVP does not mean your are registered for the event. To sign up for the ceremony or to request more information, please send an email to: [masked]

** The ceremony is organized by Oklevueha Native American Church (ONAC) of New York, and is guided by ONAC’s authorized medicine woman 'Little Owl' **
results.name: Women's Medicine Circle

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the  8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you  NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you  EXPERIENCED DANCERS , there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor

(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: Ask desk to direct you to your Organizers: Lori & Cindi
results.name: "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party at Club 412

NYC

Spread the word!

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at 8pm with Social Danicing in the Mixed Balloroom Room or the Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of: Hustle or West Coast Swing. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p.

*To enter building, Press 6 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the Mixed Ballroom Room dancing and greeting.
results.name: "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party at Club 412

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance
Blue: 90’s / 2K / Hip-Hop

Check in Location: Playwright Irish Pub, 27 West 35th Street, Manhattan, New York 10001.
Check out: St. Pat’s Bar & Grill
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: St. Pat’s Bar & Grill @ 11pm (22 West 46th Street, Manhattan, NY)

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
100 Limited Tickets

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.
results.name: Underground Party – Subway Tour!

results.description:
Timothy Sparvero, creator of the science fiction web comic INFINITY ROADS, will talk and show his art at the monthly meeting of the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County at 8:00 PM on Saturday, March 12, 2016. Mr Sparvero has illustrated stories by H P Lovecraft and has worked for the NEWARK STAR-LEDGER. His website is http://www.infinityroads.com/about-the-artist/.

There are pre meeting discussions about science fiction / fantasy / horror starting at 6:30 PM.

If you are attending a meeting of S F A B C for the first time, there is no charge. If you have previously attended and do not recall the Attendance Fee options, write to SFABCinfo (at) gmail.com.

The Association also sponsors book groups, television gatherings, movie nights and other activities each month. Visit us at www.sfabc.org.
results.name: Meet Web Comic Creator Timothy Sparvero

results.description:
Hi Friends!! 

I'm thrilled to be your brand new group organizer! I've been vegan since May 2009. Best decision ever aside from husband & dogs! Veg(an) outreach is my full-time job because I want 

(In no particular order but I do tend to emphasize point #1. I am a huge extrovert and this best utilizes my strengths. "Being vegan has brought indescribable joy to my life. I want that same joy for you!! How can we do this for? Let's start with _________" It does not mean I care ANY less for the animals. It also does not mean other approaches aren't needed!! We all have different strengths. Let's utilize them all!! Except for assholes. We should not utilize the strength of assholes.)

1) that joy for everyone!

2) to save as many non-human lives as possible!

I've included some handy question/answers from my group profile so you can get to know me better!

Will you RSVP for all our events?

I will mobilize as many of you as possible while being as involved as possible. And still taking time to keep sane in this crazy city we call home!

It's OK to not RSVP for all events. We'll have them regularly! Make sure you are also spending time with non-NYC Animal Advocacy Network friends. (Though it WILL be a challenge to miss an event b/c you'll love us so much, have met so many amazing new friends, & have a new-found, giddy spring in your step both professionally & personally!!!)

What activities are you interested in participating in with this group?

What we do is secondary to HOW we do it. Keeping in mind the #1 goal of avoiding activist burnout!! To keep the ACTIVE in our activism, we need to value

1) our own JOY, 

2) EACH OTHERS' COMPANY, 

3) SELF-CARE. 

So, yeah, we're going to have fun. We deserve it.


And we're going to get our non-vegan friends on board as allies!! I included a recent fun coloring toy from my org, VOAA. Print this out and color on it for OR with your favorite ally. You know who I'm talking about. Someone in your life who isn't vegan (yet!) but who is super f-ing awesome & supportive. If they like this, tell them they'll LOVE NYC Animal Advocacy Network & bring them to our next event!!! 

Let them know a whole bunch of other allies will be there, too, & that we are all super friendly & supportive of their progress. 

BOOM.

WE JUST DOUBLED OUR GROUP.

CRAZY EXCITED to see your beautiful faces (and your allies' beautiful faces!!!!) at the event!!!! 

Vegan hugs,

Nicole
results.name: Let's get to know each other!!

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

Satsang in Indian philosophy means (1) the company of the "highest truth," (2) the company of a guru, or (3) company with an assembly of persons who listen to, talk about, and assimilate the truth. This typically involves listening to or reading scriptures, reflecting on, discussing and assimilating their meaning, meditating on the source of these words, and bringing their meaning into one’s daily life. Contemporary spiritual teachers in the West frequently come from the East but can come from any part of the world.

 

The idea of satsangam was first spread by ancient Rishis such as Vedavyasa and Valmiki who explained its value in numerous ways.

results.description:
Celtic Appalachia is a terrific concert sponsored each year by the NY IAC featuring Mick Moloney and a cast of great Irish musicians plus a blue grass band from the south playing both separately and together. It is full of traditional upbeat Celtic reels and jigs, musically fantastic and you distinctly hear the Celtic roots in blue grass tunes and themes. Just in time for St. Patrick's Day, the legendary Mick Moloney leads audiences on a journey of discovery from the music of Ulster Scot and African banjo traditions through the American South to the development of bluegrass, country, and old-time music.
David Bing and the High Ridge Ramblers' West Virginian mountain blend of banjo, fiddle, and guitar will showcase the beauty, history, and fun-loving nature of Appalachia with twisty mountain tunes, early bluegrass ballads, old-time songs, and hard-driving fiddle tunes.
Anchored by the beloved Green Fields of America -- one of the nation's best-known and longest running Irish American groups-the evening includes songs from traditional and original folk duet Murphy Beds, and rhythmic steps from dancers Shannon Dunne and Meghan Downes and Niall O'Leary for a rousing tribute to the thriving Irish and Appalachian musical traditions. 

Everyone would need to buy their own tickets by calling[masked]-5400. They have recently gone on sale but this concert sells out quickly, is only one night and it is not one to miss! 

Optional pre-meetup at The Parlour for drinks and dinner before the show, Let me know if you'd like to join us by posting a comment here - last year we had a blast!

Hope to see you there! 


Robin
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-meetup at the Parlour for those who wish to get together for dinner/drinks before the show. Buy your own tickets to the concert, we will not be sitting together
results.name: Celtic Appalachia at Symphony Space plus Dinner

results.description:
Ethical Brew is proud to present Live In Concert: JOE CROOKSTON

FOR TICKETS & MORE INFORMATION: www.ethicalbrew.org

A portion of this performance will be donated WhyHunger

JOE CROOKSTON

Singer, songwriter, guitarist, fiddler, banjo player, painter. As a performer, Joe Crookston is a true artist, painting compelling portraits of both the unsung and anti-heroes who populate the American landscape. From the depths of despair in the prison cell of high school dropout, Freddie "the Falcon", to high above the New York skyline where a window washer sings of his young child who thinks he can fly, Joe's masterfully crafted lyrics will take you on an emotional journey that will delight your ears and engage your heart.

Joe is a consummate storyteller and skillful musician whose dexterity on guitar, claw hammer banjo and violin to name a few, is sure to astound you. His songs have been performed and recorded by Irish harpers, a capella gospel choirs, solo artists, bluegrass bands and even by a certain Buddhist sect in France! His heart-wretching song, Blue Tattoo, based on the life of concentration camp survivor Dina Jacobson, was the inspiration for a documentary of the same name, and was featured this summer in a special news segment on ABC. Joe was awarded a year-long songwriting grant from the Rockefeller Foundation to travel throughout New York State, collect stories, and write original songs.

When not touring, Joe enjoys teaching and facilitating at songwriting workshops across the country. His impressive discography includes Georgia I'm Here (2014), Darkling & The Bluebird Jubilee (2011), Able Baker Charlie and Dog (2008), Fall Down As The Rain (2004).. Here's what folks are saying about Joe Crookston ...

https://youtu.be/KrdlYftMn94?list=PLh0mUhu5JztQTofiIIhsScY5AfTemR6lc

His CD, "Able Baker Charlie & Dog" received the most airplay of any folk acoustic recording and was awarded:
"Album of the year" by the International Folk Alliance in Memphis, TN.

"At every festival I hope to find the gift of one artist whose songwriting and preforming stand out. Joe Crookston was that gift for me this year at the Philadelphia Folk Festival. Stunning performance, great songs, and not a word wasted! I LOVE that!"

-- David Francey, Songwriter Ontario

"Notably, Crookston's no newcomer, and so it's no surprise that his music sounds savvy and assured, lacking any hint of pretense or needless redundancy. This is wonderful, engaging and gorgeous music, born from an artist who fully deserves a boatload of acclamation."

-- Lee Zimmerman - No Depression


"With all the performers out there, an artist has to go beyond good... and Joe does"

-- Sing Out Magazine

For more about Joe Crookston:<a> joecrookston.com</a>
results.name: Ethical Brew presents Live in Concert: JOE CROOKSTON

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

Drink Specials & Snacks -

• FREE Shot for all this month's birthdays

• FREE Snacks for everybody

Music, Prizes & Giveaways -

• DJ spins best of 80s & 90s party music on lower level

• VJ plays the greatest 80s & 90s videos on main level 

• 80s & 90s themed Prizes & Giveaways

Icebreakers - 

• You will get slip of paper with an 80s or 90s song/artist

• Find person with matching song/artist & each get a FREE shot

Admission - 

• $10 first 10 tix w/ discount code "8090" at checkout 

• Get tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/809015/dates/Mar-12-2016_at_0830PM

• $15 online after that, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o   

Is this private? Yes, the venue is 100% private for our party.

How should I dress? Neat casual. No sweats, hats, etc. Jeans ok.

Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. It's a multi-group event and all are welcome, 21 & older.

Can I come alone? Yes, most will come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet other members. So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time. 

Why does your RSVP say +50? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 200+ members attending!

results.description:
Lets check out the latest movie in the Cloverfield universe:


Waking up from a car accident, a young woman finds herself in the basement of a man who says he's saved her life from a chemical attack that has turned all females over the age of 36 into a soft vaporous liquid, which can be utilized as a disinfectant.

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1179933/?ref_=nv_sr_1

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=saHzng8fxLs

We are watching the 9 PM showing. You can buy tickets here. Reserved seating. We are sitting in seats G26 and G27 if you want to sit near us.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in the theater lobby.

group.name: 365+ Cool Things To Do With Fun People In New York

results.description:
The drinks are on us as you join world-renowned mixologist and raconteur Anthony Caporale for a boozy romp through the history of spirits and cocktails in this critically-acclaimed new play with drinks and music. 

Combining Anthony's encyclopedic knowledge of beverage history and decades of bartending experience with his legendary skills as a storyteller and entertainer, The Imbible treats audiences to a completely original and thoroughly enjoyable evening of theatre. 

For More Info & Tickets: https://goo.gl/UjIeLS
results.name: The Imbible: A Spirited History of Drinking!

results.description:
Saturday Night Comedy!

The "End of The Line" Comedy Show is the place to be every second Saturday of the month in Astoria!

End of The Line is back on Saturday, February 13th! We've got an awesome lineup of some of NYC's best comedians. Featuring standup from:
Freddie Campion (GQ Magazine)
Ian Hunt (Good For You! comedy show)
Matt Schwartzer (I Don't Get It! comedy show)
Karolena Theresa
Rashad Isaac (Grad Skool comedy show)

and Improv from:
The D.A.
(Liz Arcury, Calvin Cole, Emily Duncan, Jeff Moulton, Kantad Svendsgaard, and Jon Hudson)

Come out at 9, grab a drink and a seat, and we'll start the show right at 9:30pm. You can't beat a show of this quality for just 5 bucks! *Lineup subject to change

This show has been a great hang before and after as well, so we hope to see you out next Saturday night

results.description:
So, I have never been here before so if you have any feedback about previous visits, do let me know. Otherwise, this is a great icebreaker. I plan to eat, throw back a few, and practice my "thrown off the bull" face before anyone shows up...who's with me?

**Note**

I know some people work on the weekend so if you're available on a Friday instead, let me know and I'll repost a date on a Friday.
results.name: Mechanical Bullriding Meet and Greet!!!

Room #2: Our Bachata Room with DJ Fro

AND every 2nd & 4th Saturday of the month! Time: 9pm-2am

group.name: FREE or inexpensive things to do in New York City

results.description:
Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"
results.name: Hang out, Watch Comedy, Eat Pizza (All Free)

group.name: Free comedy, pizza, and hanging out in Chelsea, Manhattan

results.description:
Join us this weekend for our fun Saturday evening @ Hudson Terrace. This is a very popular party with an amazing crowd.

We will be on the first floor of the venue near the coat check area. 

Feel free to invite your family, friends and colleagues to join us at Hudson Terrace.

Gents reduced all night long- $20. Ladies free (Mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be a 1 hour open bar from 10- 11pm.

Feel free to come solo. You are guaranteed to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

This event normally attracts people in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Please get there early to avoid the long lines.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer,

Rory

[masked]


SATURDAY NITE PARTY @ HUDSON TERRACE WITH 1 HOUR OPEN BAR! FREE ENTRY FOR LADIES!

Date: SATURDAY MARCH 12, 2016

Admission: LADIES FREE BEFORE MIDNIGHT (AFTER MIDNIGHT IS DOORMAN'S DISCRETION.

GENTS REDUCED ALL NIGHT LONG!- $20 (MENTION RORY'S LIST)

Time: 10pm- 4am

Venue: HUDSON TERRACE (621 West 46th Street Between 11th & 12th Ave)

Dress Code: BUSINESS CASUAL

Subway: TAKE A, C, 1, 2, 3, N,R,Q, S  TO 42ND STREET.

Hudson Terrace is a beautiful, lush venue with New York City skyline and Hudson River views. Their chic atmosphere, a mix between a upscale lounge and trendy nightclub, is a great place to relax on the weekend.

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

We’ve got another big night going down at the Covered VIP Rooftop at Stage 48! Rain or shine, this amazing venue, will give you an incredible scenic view of the city. Our Stage 48 party series is known to get wild, with people dancing harder than anything we’ve ever seen, so we’re really excited to see what this wonderful night on the rooftop will bring.

There Will Be 3 Dj’s Spinning Live!
Green DJ: Top 40 Dance Hits
Red DJ: 80’s/90’s/EDM Mashups
Blue DJ: Hip Hop/R&B/Reggae

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
Covered and heated VIP Rooftop
Rooftop View Of The City
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: VIP Covered Rooftop @ Stage 48!

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8, no subs. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
Try It You'll Like It and if you do, sign up and start your lessons the same day. We'll credit your try SCUBA payment towards the class and give.

For anyone who wants to test the waters, this is the Scuba Discovery Program. It gives you a glimpse into what you can expect to see in the underwater world as well as what you could expect to learn in the Scuba Diver Course. You will be shown the basic safety procedures for scuba diving under the watchful eye of an instructor. You will learn skills like equalizing your ears, buddy checks, basic buoyancy control, underwater communication and an introduction to basic scuba equipment and scuba skills followed by an underwater dive in the pool. If you enjoy this experience then the Open Water Scuba Diver course is your next step.

Need more info? Call the Dive Center[masked]

What's Required?

• A curiosity about scuba diving

• A swimsuit and a towel

If you have a mask, snorkel, and fins, bring them.

If not, we'll loan you ours – we will provide everything else!

If all spots are filled get on the waiting list we may run a 2nd session that day

Cost: $25.00 Click to Pay Now!  (Get a $25 credit for your Lessons)

If at the end of the session you are ready to start. You can sign up on the spot and hop right back in.

Just bring a bathing suit and towel and leave everything else to us!

IMPORTANT:

Please print and complete the following three forms to bring to the pool

•  Student Information Form

• SDI General Waiver for all Courses

• SDI Medical Info Waiver

*Physician Sign-Off Form This form MUST BE COMPLETED if the answer to ANY question on the "Medical Info Waiver form is YES before participating

Please note that the entrance to the pool where "Try Scuba" is being held is located in the rear parking lot of the Lodi Boys and Girls Club.

results.name: Try Scuba in the Pool this Sunday

results.description:
Four excellent games by each team last week. Games were competitive but went by pretty quick.


For many of the newer ppl that is aware of our history, this group used to be nothing more than a few friends playing a game we all love. It was a struggle to get even a 6 on 6 game but our meetup has grown immensely. Thirty plus people show up regularly, requiring that we set up two separate games. With the influx of people it has fundamentally change the way I organize everything.

Rules we knew by heart have to be reinforced or put in writing for all to understand, ensuring different players get a fair chance playing with different QB's, cracking the whip to modify some ppl's unsportsman-like behavior, and the juggling of personalities/divas is another issue.

I appreciate the feedback last week and as a result each game will have a time limit of 1 hour's play. The purpose of this structure is to ensure teams get to play other teams, in a round robin format, since we consistently have enough for two separate games now. This will keep things fresh instead of a trench warfare kind of a game that stretches 3 hours just so one team scores 5, 6, or 7 points for the win. If each game is a max of 1 hour then theoretically we can play the three other teams before noon.

While some receivers complain they don't get any looks with certain QB's, this is not a matter that should be voiced to me until you have tried to communicate (that doesn't mean screaming) with the QB yourself. I'm not your babysitter and I personally have never complained a QB hasn't given any receiver a fair chance. As I noted, I try to rotate each person to different QB's so please stop telling me to put you in the game with your friends. This creates an environment whereby the QB will always focus on their friend and neglect the other receivers on the team. I'm not perfect so if I put you on with the same QB then you can let me know and I'll be more cognizant of it next time. Additionally, one of our cardinal rule is that if you're late you will have to wait until the next game. Please do not pull your friend onto your team. This will no longer be tolerated.

Lastly, Super Ramon stated his record has been a perfect 5-0 the past two weeks. I do take that into consideration when I set up the teams and why teams may not always appear "equal." My goal is to always make the teams competitive, hoping the eventual score is a close 5-4, or so, game. It's why tier 2 or 3 QB's have a stronger set of receivers than a tier 1 QB; a good QB can carry a whole team. It is also why I switch some receivers from some teams if they can blow away another team 5-0 or 5-1.

While I may be a loud mouth (but not as big of one like King or Abe) in enforcing the rules (and my way), it's done with much thought in making the games more safe and fun. This meetup is not about any single person, including myself; but it's about what's in the best interest of EVERYONE!

Game will be in Bay 8th. Dyker is being used by soccer leagues now.


Yours truly,

Miketator

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

results.description:
Quick Note.... Day Light Savings Time Starts Sunday Morning at 2am. So Please turn Your Clocks Ahead 1 Hour on Saturday Night before you go to bed.

Hello Walkers.. Back By Popular Demand ! The Henry Hudson Trail ....  This is a Favorite for many of you.

Since the weather has be getting nicer,,,, Lets celebrate the First Day of Spring one week early ! 

Here's your chance to Capture all the Beauty that Nature has to offer... Even during the Last week Winter, on the Henry Hudson Trail !

So on March 13th at 9:00am... Come out and join us for this Wonderful Walk... 

Thank you all for coming at least 10 minutes early,,,,

We will Meet in the  Commuter Parking Lot on The Left that you will pass on the way to Sissy's...

This is always a fun walk for all the Newbies to come out and get acquainted with everyone. It has some spectacular views.... Like the one's pictured here...

Believe it or not this is actually a little Park off to the side of the trail. Some even call it the "Secret Garden". We can take a quick peek at it if you wish... It only takes a couple of minutes to do it.

We will be walking in an Easterly Direction till we hit the end of the trail. Take a break for a few minutes, talk about the Great Breakfast we all want to have, and head on back to our starting point. From there, for those who want to join us for coffee & a bite to eat. We'll probably go to Town & Surf Diner which is walking distance from where we parked.  The food is Very Good, and they always take good care of us,,,

Sneakers may be worn but You might want to wear Hiking Boots/Shoes for walking on this trail,,,

As always, we will walk in a LIGHT RAIN and Sunshine

Please Remember to Dress for the Weather !

See you all @ 9:00am. SHARP !

Only A Heavy Rain or Blizzard ( LOL )  will Cancel.

This Rarely ever happens !

Those who RSVPed will be notified by e-mail of any Cancellation.

If you have any doubts, Please check your E-mail.

It will Also be Posted on this Page and Calendar.

• As A Friendly Reminder, Furry and 4 legged friends May Not  join us. Thank you for understanding.

• Please Update your RSVP's as needed,,, The Group and the Organizers Thank you ;~)

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

results.description:
Hi Everyone,
There will be two fermentation workshops at the annual Just Food Conference on Sunday, March 13th. Details on the conference and the fermentation workshops are below. Hope to see some of you there!

Best,
Angela Davis
NYC Ferments Co-organizer

The annual Just Food Conference convenes over 700 community organizers, urban and rural farmers, CSA members, educators, local food enthusiasts, and members of the press for a full day of interactive workshops, policy disucssions, and good food. Programming will include urban agriculture skill-building, cooking and food preservation techniques, current opportunities to advocate for equitable food policy, and strategies for mobilizing communities to create more equitable access to fresh, locally grown food.

The 2016 Just Food Conference will be held on Sunday, March 13th, in partnership with the Laurie M. Tisch Center for Food, Education & Policy at Teachers College, Columbia University. We are thrilled to announce that the farmers of Rise & Root Farm  will deliver our keynote address. For tickets and more information, visit JustFoodConference.org. 

Registration: $40-65.  Limited scholarships are available.

Click here for scholarship information. Scholarship Deadline: Monday, February 8th, 11:59 pm<a href="https://docs.google.com/a/justfood.org/forms/d/1wowtXY22Gc2t-dktEupgYv7uQbpZtgwXAbT6PjaGqy8/viewform"></a>

Workshop Session 1 (TIME: 11:10 AM - 12:40 PM)

The Invisible World of Microbes: The Human Gut Microbiome, Probiotics, and Fermented Foods.

What is the gut microbiome? This workshop will explain what the human gut microbiome is, why scientists think it's important in supporting our mental and physical health, and how probiotics fit into the picture.The workshop will also include information on identifying and where to find foods that have microbiomes and a fun demo on how to make fermented foods that are full of healthy bacteria!

Speakers:  Erin Cramm & Cheryl Paswater


Workshop Session 2 (TIME: 2:50 PM - 4:20 PM)

Fermentation 101

Fermentation - What, Why and How
- What? Learn what fermentation is, its origins, and its role through history. 
- Why? Learn the importance and health benefits of eating fermented foods.
- How? Learn a few  fool-proof techniques for fermenting vegetables.

Speakers: Nadia Ernestus Certified Holistic Health Coach, Owner, Hamptons Brine
results.name: Fermentation Worskhops at Just Food Conference, 3.13

Whether you want to play competitively, hit around, or even just check out the hot guys and girls, you've come to the right place. I will try to host the badminton events on bi-weekly basis in order to provide you with an badminton experience where you can get your daily exercise in, improve at the game of badminton, and socialize with other fellow badminton-ers, all at the same time!

After the badminton event, we will have lunch together at Flushing.

Sport cloth and sneaker.

Badminton racquets and birdies, bottles of water, towel and clothes to change.

New York Badminton Center,[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 ( enter 34th Ave from College Point Blvd )
New York Badminton Center (NYBC) is designated badminton facility with 6 international tournament standard Badminton floor mats on top of 3″ high wood floor elevation for maximum shock absorbing and pressure reduction to knees and ankles.  Center also equipped with Table Tennis, Weights room, kids room, and spacious resting area, large bathrooms. Center opens 7 days all year around. It offers the convenience for players to play on any of the days they prefer. Center is close to public transportation (about 10 mins walking), street parking is also available.   

For more info about NY Badminton Center, check the link in the reference section below.

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time. With the cold weather, we will get rolling on time so that our runners don't get too cold waiting for others to show. 

If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

A Stokes Forest Loop, around 9 miles, with some climbs but a lot of valley walking. We will hike the Swenson Tr. to the Cartwright and then up to Sunrise Mtn. Next we take the AT to the Culvers Lookout Tower, and it’s mostly downhill to Stony Lake Parking. This is a strenuous hike.

Meet: 9:00 a.m. Stony Lake Parking, Stokes State Forest, Coursen Rd, Sandyston, NJ 07826
From I-80 West Exit 34B: Take Rt-15 north about 17 mi. to Rt-206 (Rt-15 ends). Continue straight on Rt-206 north 6+ mi. towards Culvers Gap and AT trail crossing sign. Proceed an additional ½ mi. and the Park Entrance is on the right off Rt-206. Drive by the Ranger Station on Coursen Rd about 2 mi bear sharp right and continue ¼ mi to parking lot on left.

Stony Lake Parking, Coursen Rd, Sandyston, NJ 07826 GPS [masked], [masked])

REMEMBER the CLOCKS go ahead one hour Saturday night

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
“…to be successful in life you need values, you need integrity, you need a vision, you need energy, and you need dynamism. And spirituality is the one thing that gives it all to you. If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

This free seminar examines what comes in the way of our happiness. There will be a discussion on tools that can lead us to happiness – tools that every human being is privileged to learn and use. Come, relax, refresh and smile.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
